title: Amazing and works great

review:
So, I‚Äôve seen the ads for this app, and I‚Äôm deeply disappointed üòî. I love that you can personalize it and stuff, it even gives you a Q&A beforehand, so they know what‚Äôs right for you. I get done with the questions, and open it up, before I look at ANY of the stories, it asked me to get a subscription..... and I thought that subscriptions were optional (that‚Äôs were I was wrong), I started looking at all the stories and I see that EVERY SINGLE ONE is locked until you subscribe. Not a single story is free.
And I was really excited to get this app, and it was a complete disappointment. I just feel like there needs to be a ‚Äúfree stories ‚Äù section for the people (like myself) who can‚Äôt afford a subscription.
title: I didn‚Äôt even get to try it......

review: I love this app and recommend it to anyone who need some calm in their life. However, I‚Äôm very displeased with all the name dropping of famous people. Today‚Äôs meditation quoted Taylor Swift and a few before quoted LeBron James. This seems very commercial and unnecessary. I use this app to help get away from the world and find myself being extremely irritated by the included quotes, which I can only assume are included merely because they are famous and perhaps giving money to the company. If I wanted nuggets of wisdom from famous people I would follow them on Instagram or Twitter. In my opinion, this app is just becoming another platform for rich and influential people. It makes me sad.
title: I love, but... name dropping... ugh

review:
Calm is awesome. As someone who has tried every drug on the planet to fall asleep (and usually without success), who would have thought that the quiets and most reliable way to fall asleep was a sleep story. I‚Äôve been using Calm for 2 years now and will likely be a subscriber until the day I die. 

Guided meditations are also great. I really like the Daily Calm. It means that every day there is something new to listen to and each day I learn new things thanks to the theme of the Daily Calm that day. I‚Äôm continually impressed.
title: I rely on this app far more than I ever expected

review: As much publicity meditation gets from Hollywood and the people you will see in the app. I can't help but be bothered that there's nothing I can click on that doesn't require me signing up for premium. Yes there's a 7 day free trial but how annoying I'm sorry. I don't mean to sound so ungreaful yall but people are in so much pain!! I myself almost lost my leg a month ago and I'm in excruciating pain! But I just think this is a time when people who tend to stick to certain agendas actually go above and beyond to not be so superficial actually be the change for once. I'll probably end up signing up but not before I get this off my chest.
title: I'm sorry yall I'm just bothered üòî

review:
I tired maybe 10 different meditations apps and after nearly a whole year of searching, I decided on this one. Even got the lifetime subscription for it since I personally hate to add to my monthly expenses and feel a lot more relaxed knowing that I‚Äôm not wasting my money by not using it ‚Äúenough‚Äù in a month.

It has bells, nature sounds, music, stories, pretty backgrounds, it looks nice and it‚Äôs quite polished for an app. And yes, it has a good meditation collection as well as new daily ones. 

Some suggestions for future updates:

More nature sounds and higher resolution backgrounds.  Casting this app on tv would be great too. And I definitely would not complain if you would add binaural sounds option for those of us with headphones.

Overall, if anyone out there is still hesitating on which meditation/calming app to get, I would say: just get this one. It‚Äôs good and it gets updated regularly.
title: Best of them all

review: I have been using the free version for almost a year now. Money is tight with COVID-19 and today I went into to the sessions where they have the free sessions to listen to and practice meditation where locked and I now had to pay. It hurts that they would take things like this away. I had been hoping that when money wasn‚Äôt so tight I‚Äôd be able to get a paid membership, but I don‚Äôt know if I can trust them right now and feel they aren‚Äôt really trying to help people become less stressed and more mindful if they are practically forcing people to start paying to use their app when there is so much negative stuff still hanging around.
title: Feeling Hurt

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few weeks now. I decided that I wanted to start meditation and needed some guidance and I heard this app was good for beginners. The free trial was so awesome that for the first time I subscribed to a lifestyle app. I literally look forward to meditating everyday because of this app. The narrator is so calming and relaxing. Every feeling that I‚Äôve had during the meditation she acknowledges and calms me down, it almost feels like she‚Äôs right next to me. Everything is just so approachable. I can‚Äôt wait to try out the sleep features.
title: Really great so far

review: This is the first app I‚Äôve ever reviewed, i usually feel it‚Äôs useless to do but I had to submit one for Calm. I suffer from depression and major anxiety, to the point where I can‚Äôt breath and think. Everyone of my therapists have tried getting me to meditate but I could never make it work. Calm was the first app that helped me settle (calm) my mind. It taught me to be able to meditate even when Im not using the app. There‚Äôs also tons of other great uses as well. The sleeping aids help tremendously as well. I recommend this app completely!
title: Expensive..... but worth every penny!

review: How can I continue to face the challenges of working as chaplain (emotional/psychological /spiritual support) during the many crises of a trauma center without my own balance? From one moment to the next I am looking into the eyes & hearts of a suffering humanity. Knowing we are not alone in our pain by connecting to another mitigates that challenging experience. I have been learning daily from my ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù app for nearly 2 years. And I am ever so grateful it was recommended to me each time I am able to return to the safe haven I find within.
title: Safe Haven

review:
As an educator, I‚Äôve been using Calm for years to help my students unwind after standardized testing and to help me fall asleep. I love this app. I have favorite narrators, and if I have a hard time falling asleep, I know if I put on anything by Bhav, Alan, or Eric, I‚Äôll be asleep in minutes. 

HOWEVER

This newest update has made Calm stay on the opening screen, and not move beyond ‚Äútake a deep breath.‚Äù I can‚Äôt get to the sleep stories! And having gone through an interstate move and starting a new job in the past two weeks, my stress is at an all time high. Please, Calm, fix your app! Thank you!
title: I just wish they‚Äôd patch it!

review: So I love the sleep stories. I think most people agree one persons relaxing voice can be grating to another. I don‚Äôt understand except from a guess that she started the app why the meditation section is totally dominated by one person in particular. And I‚Äôm sure there might be many that find her voice nice but personally I would like variety and am disappointed I pay for calm and while the sleep stories keep having a wide range of readers , for those of us who want to meditate it‚Äôs always the same person. Please expand on options. Especially in light if nothing else or cultural diversity etc
title: Same voice for almost all meditations?

review: For the last 3 years I have had a lot of life changes.  Managing mind, health and body have been difficult.  I‚Äôve closed in on addictive behaviors, depression and anxiety.  This app helps to keep some things in check for me; along with regular therapy sessions and checking in with my doctors.  I‚Äôm able to manage the harder parts of life without the use of medications.  I‚Äôm able to start making better choices that I believe will become better habits.  I enjoy the short yoga sessions and the stress management features.
title: Making it thru

review: I have struggled with near-constant disassociation for over 15 years now. I‚Äôm still in the free trial of this app but I have seen so much improvement already I am paying after my trial ends. I can‚Äôt remember the last time I felt like I really existed but I am remembering things in detail again like my walks listening to Calm. I‚Äôm not as anxious while working. In general keeping this apps lessons or music playing helps me focus and/or calm down. This app is changing my life and I‚Äôm so thankful for everyone involved in making it.
title: I didn‚Äôt expect so much

review:
I was hesitant to drop $70 for the year, but made sure when I started the week trial I was really ready to put it to the test. I have been using Calm for a couple months now and it‚Äôs well worth the less than $6 per month price tag. 

The variety is great, Tamara is awesome, and I love that you can identify meditations as favorites. 

The one thing that I really find myself wanting is the ability to also identify ALL meditations that I have tried. Some I don‚Äôt care to return to, but don‚Äôt have a way to know which they are. With that functionality, Calm would be an easy 5 stars from me.
title: Love Calm, BUT

review:
I‚Äôve had the calm app for a few years now. I love the sleep stories and have told many about them. However, in the past 2 months this app has been buggy beyond usable. I‚Äôve had to uninstall and reinstall more than once, which is not what you want to deal with when you‚Äôre trying to wind down and sleep for the evening. The two main issues I‚Äôve had are the app just not loading (staying on ‚Äútake a deep breath‚Äù screen) or the scenes not playing in the background, which I use for white noise as I live in an urban area. 

Hope these bugs get fixed soon and permanently!!
title: Would be great if it worked consistently

review: Why have a free version of this app? Just don‚Äôt offer one. I knew I couldn‚Äôt be the only person that was highly disappointed in the amount of content locked. Look, I‚Äôm all for you guys having a good product and charging for it‚Äôs service, but just don‚Äôt bother people with a version of it that is clearly worthless. I might of paid a smaller amount to download and been happy with some of the content still being locked, but to open the app and have access to so few things is a joke and a waste of time. Just rethink your approach to customers. Make it very transparent in your advertising that simply downloading the app is not going to be what they‚Äôre expecting. Very misleading and poor marketing. Shameful really.
title: Just don‚Äôt offer a free version?

review: This app may seem great on the outside, but this is probably one of the most money-demanding apps I‚Äôve ever seen. In the summer, I tend to sleep a lot less since it‚Äôs so  hot, which makes me uncomfortable. I‚Äôve been wanting to better my sleep in the summer for years now, and Calm seemed like  the perfect solution. However, when I got the app, I quickly realized that 99% of ALL content is behind a paywall. This app might as well not even have any free audio and force you to get a subscription for access to anything. It is near impossible to find complete and free audio. I am a teenager, I need good sleep to function. Now, I am a few nights further from getting the amount of sleep I need.
title: Probably good, I wouldn‚Äôt know.

review: This is a fantastic app and continually adds new content to and for sleep stories, meditations, classes , music and more. I especially like the daily Calm and the new Daily trip. I love Eric Braa and Jeff Warren‚Äôs soothing and clear voices. Some of the story tellers and speakers have voices that are difficult (for me) to hear or listen to, but these two men have wonderful voices, clear enunciation, and soothing speech. I love the constant updating of new material and variety. If a person is serious about calming their life, he or she will not regret purchasing this wonderful app.
title: Great selection of meditations

review: I tried it a few years ago and I liked it but I have it free for a year through being in an HR program and I‚Äôm really liking the daily calms and also the sleep meditation but it doesn‚Äôt seem to be a lot of sleep meditations which is kind of bothering me at only looks like there‚Äôs like 10 or 15 so what happens after I do it for a few weeks I thought it would be like hundreds so if the developer is reading this I‚Äôm a little disappointed about that but maybe I‚Äôll find other stuff to listen to at night
title: Doesn‚Äôt seem like it has a lot of sleep meditations

review:
I have really been enjoying this app. I love that there are so many options. 

My biggest problem though is that there is no place to see everything I have favorited! Why?! There are like three different areas that show favorites but none of them list everything, I hate it. 

The downside to so much content is when you don‚Äôt provide a way for people to easily find favorite items. Please make this slightly easier to use by giving us one place to see our favorites. One list with meditations, sleep stories, music, all of it.
title: Cant find favorites

review: I wish her cadence had less affectation. A bit too ‚Äúhypnotist‚Äù for me- the sing song vibe becomes repetitive and inauthentic after I heard it a number of times. And you will hear her voice A LOT. The majority of the meditations I‚Äôve listened to have her voice and often the only option. The male voice, while not my preference, has much less affectation. It‚Äôs the neutrality I prefer. The straightforward speaking style. I do love the app though and appreciate the effort they‚Äôve made towards some diversity in voices.
title: Wish Tamara Levitt‚Äôs cadence had less affectation

review: This is easily my fav app. I‚Äôve been using this app for almost two years now. Calm saved me from having a mental breakdown during distance learning. As an educator, this is a must app to have. With all the negativity that‚Äôs been happening in the world, calm makes me calm. I also love listening to other people‚Äôs perspectives on Spark. The daily calm is a part of my morning routine, sleep stories/meditation is a part of my evening routine. Amazing master class topics too. I just love everything about it. Thank you Calm. I appreciate all you do üßòüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Calm makes me calm

review:
When I saw this add I was like Oh this is gonna help me sleep so much! So I downloaded but realized that you have to BUY premium to even listen to stories which made me pretty upset..I‚Äôm begging you calm begging you! Please make it so some stories for sleeping available because I bet kids wanted to get this app just like me but kids don‚Äôt have money..! So it‚Äôs a little unfair..yes I sound like I‚Äôm a kid writing this well it‚Äôs because I am! Also I have a tip if u see this

Tip: if u turn on airplane mode when playing a game with LOTS AND LOTS of ads then all the ads will go away! Your welcome

Hopefully everyone is safe in quarantine Bc I‚Äôm writing this in quarantine lol ‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ‚ú®
title: Good but..

review: I have tried several meditation apps and this is by far my favorite. The paid subscription is pricey but I have found it well worth the cost. I enjoy the techniques taught in the meditations to learn to accept emotions and let go of what doesn‚Äôt serve me. I love that the meditations don‚Äôt have music but you can choose a background sound as needed. Tamara has a very soothing voice. I also use the breathing bubble, the mood check-ins, and the master courses. Highly recommended! Thanks for such a great product!
title: Fantastic meditation and self growth app

review: There are two options with this app: the free version which allots you very little or the premium version which is a commitment of over $50/month. Way too expensive for someone like me on a tight budget. I realize everyone needs to earn a living and it‚Äôs fair for the owners of Calm to set a value/price for their service, but it would be nice if they made it a little more universally accessible. A lack of money/inability to earn a livable wage is one of the biggest and most common sources of stress and turmoil a person can experience. It‚Äôs ironic that this app is one of the more expensive monthly subscriptions I‚Äôve seen and is supposed to aid in stress-reduction. Frankly, it‚Äôs a little off-putting.
title: Would be/could be great

review: I am an young athlete and stressed every minute. I do well in school and have big dreams but I am always so stressed if I will complete them. I just started and saw many ads about this. I kept putting it off and then tried LeBron James session. I completely just know the app is amazing and will become better in the future. The app just helps me stay calm. I can sometimes get mad easily or just say the wrong thing at the wrong time. I love this apps and you can just open your whole self up to this app. Totally recommend!
title: New but In Love

review:
I deal with ADD, depression and Social anxiety. I was recommended meditation and I decided I‚Äôd try it. I first downloaded this app in 2017. And used it and loved it for a while until the app updated and now to do any sort of guided meditation longer than two days you have to pay the hefty price of 70 bucks a year. It irks me when apps like this are advertised to ‚ÄúImprove your mental health.‚Äù When in reality they are monetary traps meant to exploit and take advantage of those who are at a vulnerable point in their lives. More proof that mental illness is being commercialized and used as a means to reap profit. They should be ashamed. Offering up an app that‚Äôs supposed to help people who are desperate for help then turning around and paywalling them.
It‚Äôs a shame because this app had potential.
title: Was good until...

review: I came across this app through an Instagram app and decided to try it out. I love the wilderness sounds especially living in the city. Once in a while I can hear birds chirping in the morning but it‚Äôs very minimal so that‚Äôs why I love just hearing the sound of wilderness while using the app. The second time I went on Calm, I decided to try out the sleep cognition sound for about 30min before actually going to sleep and I fell asleep right away. I‚Äôm excited to explore the app a little more. Definitely recommend Calm to anybody!
title: Such a great app

review: I‚Äôve absolutely adored this app! I‚Äôve had it for over a year. I first started using it for free, but quickly realized being a paying member would be worth it. If you use it daily, or even weekly, It‚Äôs honestly such a small price to pay and 100% worth the investment. I primarily utilize the sleep stories, and play rain at night.. but I‚Äôve also dabbled in daily check ins, master classes, and meditation. This app has saved me from so many anxiety driven nights. I will forever be grateful to this platform. Thank you!!
title: A safe place to land

review: I have used and like the meditations nd talke, but my favorite feature is the sleep stories. I love listening to them and they usually lead me to sleep. If not, they still are calming and engaging. The only issue I have with this app is after a while of using it, it keeps crashing, and you have to delete it and reload it.  It doesn‚Äôt save all your settings, but favorites are saved. I gave this four stars for its great content, but wish they could fix the problem with crashing.
title: Love the sleep stories

review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for a few years and it has totally changed my life. The guided meditations are amazing. This review is less for the service and more for this actual app. 

- Once you complete a program, there‚Äôs no way to start it over in the app, you now have to manually manage the series and your place in it. I often restart a series and I have to ‚Äúheart‚Äù the last one I did in order to keep track OR I have to go through my history to try to find out which one I last did. 

- There‚Äôs no search. I have to remember which category a certain program I am looking for is in. 

I feel like I can‚Äôt be the only one that restarts programs but it just seems like it would be an easy fix for the service to indicate where I left off last better. 

With that being said, this app is worth every penny and I‚Äôm grateful to y‚Äôall for putting it together üñ§
title: The Calm service is great but the app really needs improvements

review: I think calm is a wonderful way to reduce my anxiety and help me sleep better. The one issue I‚Äôm having is that when I want a sleep story there is only two stories to listen to and I‚Äôm getting tired of listening to them over and over again. There should be more story‚Äôs and maybe consider the music to have 1 open. But overall it is an amazing app to help yourself CALM ( get it üòâ) down. It can get a 5 star app if you just add a few more story‚Äôs that are not locked, and some music or calming sounds I can listen to!
title: Maybe calm premium doesn‚Äôt have all of the good stories

review: I wanted to like this app. But it‚Äôs customer service not CALMing at all. It‚Äôs also non-existent. I did the free trial and enjoyed the guided meditations, especially from Tamara. She‚Äôs good. But, I needed to wait to do the $70 sub and went to cancel it before the deadline. When I did so, it offered me the sub at $48 instead of $70. So, I agreed. Come to find out, it still charged me $70, which I would not have paid. When I went to look for support, the Calm site is just a circle of no way to contact anyone. They redirect you to Apple for any refunds. Well, Apple has no way to partial refund, so it was either keep the sub for $70 or get a full refund. I chose the latter. And that‚Äôs a shame because the app content is great. It‚Äôs just horribly managed outside of that. Thanks for nothing.
title: Shady subscription

review: I‚Äôve had this app for around a year now, and in the second half of this last year I noticed that the app slowly started getting, well, slower. It takes literally a solid 5-10 minutes just to load one session now, if it loads at all! It‚Äôs extremely frustrating to want to take time to relax and recoup my mind, yet I sit there anxiously waiting for it to start and just get more annoyed from the wait. Not to mention I‚Äôm often on a time crunch and having to wait SO long JUST to start a session is ridiculous, and many times lately I‚Äôve had to forego the session. Wasted money paying for the full version and not being able to use it. :(
title: Great app for meditation... if it loads

review: Calm app helped keep my newborn happy and me relaxed through quarantine. Whether playing our baby, or myself, a sleep story, or using the soundscapes while working from home, the content is practical: volume doesn‚Äôt fluctuate like on some podcasts, stories are just stories and not ads, and everything is organized well. And it‚Äôs all relaxing. They also add new content often enough to keep it fresh. One request: please keep the train and non-fiction sleep stories coming! Thanks.
title: Worth subscription!

review: This app has been a tremendous help for my anxiety. I struggle with anxiety on an almost daily basis, along with semi-frequent panic attacks. I have been using the Calm app to meditate daily. There are several series on managing stress and anxiety. I started off with the free version and then quickly purchased the full version. My husband and I enjoy listening to the soundscapes at night as well. The price seems steep, but if you break it down to what it would be per month, it‚Äôs not bad at all. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this app. Thank you, Calm!
title: Miracle App

review: I really love the calm app and it has made me see the value of meditation in my daily life. However, if you don‚Äôt have the premium version you can only do about 5 of the meditations, and they have hundreds in their library. This is frustrating to me because I know that not everyone has the financial means to purchase the premium membership, yet apps like these strive the make mental health care accessible to people of all walks of life. I think it would be beneficial for the calm app to unlock at least a few more of the meditations so that the largest number of people can benefit from their great resources.
title: make mental health care more accessible

review:
I love they added Harry Styles 
Love how you can do chew I in and then it shows you what story you can use to help with that so good u have the levels of stress and depression down I only have anxiety attacked once a week now instead of every night this has really help me with my depression and help me see a different side of life same with my stress
I like how you unlock the app with taking a deep breath to get in that feeling of that sort of mood 5/5 recommend
Ps: I have the premium or what ever and let me tell you soooooooo worth it
üòô
title: It literally so good

review: I just want to say I am so surprised to love this app.  I have really high BP since I was 46, and have been trying to help myself with meditating.  I just want to tell you guys I love Jeff!  He is so cool and non-dorky that I am shocked.  Tai non-authoritative like other meditation teachers who admonish is to ‚Äúfocus only on the breath‚Äù for example.  But no, Jeff introduces the concept of ‚Äúhomebase‚Äù where you can focus on anything you choose.  So I have chosen the tip of my nose for some reason lol..  Thank you Jeff for this wonderful series I hope you read this review.
title: I love the ‚ÄúHow to Meditate series ‚Äú

review: I was dealing with sudden, unexpected loss and CALM played a significant role in my regaining my peace. Personally, the meditations were extremely helpful, especially at bedtime where sleep was a challenge. I also was suddenly dealing with high blood pressure, often the physical consequence of trauma. I focused on the daily meditations and self care and found my new path. This only works if you: 1) Believe; 2) Really want change; 3) Commit. I have not found a more useful, significant app that offers true support and healing. FANTASTIC! AMAZING! LIFE ALTERING!
title: When Your Life Takes an Unexpected Turn...

review: I am a calm convert. I was hesitant about trying this app, particularly about taking the extra step of paying if I liked the free version, but I couldn‚Äôt help but love it. It took me a long while, but after listening to Stephen Fry lull me to sleep every night for a month with his free sleep story, I was hooked. I purchased the app. Just for the sleep stories, this app is worth it. The very fact that I get meditation, music, etc. in addition to my beloved sleep stories is icing on the cake. And I‚Äôm using it all!!! Do yourself a favor, try it, buy it.
title: Calm Convert

review: I‚Äôm using Calm today whilst in the terrible California fire season. I listened (and am listening as I write this) to the background ‚Äúscene‚Äù I chose of gentle rain falling on leaves, and over that the excellent session with Tamara Levitt on Procrastination, an avoidance behavior that has for years undermined my aspirations. I feel both soothed and motivated! Yesterday I listened to a hypnotic description of the Bodelian library. I have also listened to the beautiful deep voice of LeBron James describing his approach to success, and felt motivated and uplifted. Calm is an excellent resource for surviving this crazy 2020.
title: Gentle Rain

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for years. I stepped away the past few months but when I came back I found that the ‚ÄúDaily Trip‚Äù. Levitt‚Äôs Daily Calm is the centerpiece of the Calm app but it seems to be getting phased out. Its very hard to find. Search bar just brings up 2 collection of Daily Calm entries from the past.

Levitt's Daily Calm has pulled me through some tough times. Her voice is a big part of going back to that warm place. I do not like that I have to dig for it or go to the browser version. It is still the first meditation on the home screen in the desktop browser version.
title: Daily Calm missing from Home Screen

review:
I like the soundscapes they have. I love the features where it‚Äôs your background. 

However, a good portion of the material uses the same narrator. It‚Äôs stressful because I don‚Äôt like the her voice. üòÖ I think that‚Äôs important to me because the previous app I paid for had unlimited narrators and meditations. I need the variety because I already struggle with guided meditation. And I need them occasionally because  I get anxiety attacks. 

If it wasn‚Äôt for my medical provider offering it to me, I would not purchase.  But the content seems great if you can stand Tamara narrating most of the content.
title: I like the soundscapes... I can‚Äôt stand many of the narrators & music

review: I do like this app but the main problem is that you can‚Äôt access 75% of the sounds/stories without paying for them. There‚Äôs a total of 4 sleep stories available in the entire list that is unlocked without paying. Two of which I don‚Äôt use since the narrators voice is not soothing to me. I literally switch between two sleep stories at night which seems a little ridiculous but it still has been helping me fall asleep much faster. I don‚Äôt use it for meditation yet so I can‚Äôt say much for that, I only use it for sleep. I would even be okay if some of the sleep sounds would be unlocked ie rain/ocean ect but nope. Gotta pay for those too.
title: Great app too expensive

review: I was introduced to meditation in my teens in India by my father and various other teachers but after moving out of India more than a decade ago I lost touch with my practice with life getting busier and and busier. I was not able to find time and a good instructor( I enjoy guided mediations) but then I came across Calm and Tamara Levitt! I enjoy her 10 min daily calms where she offers great breathing techniques and wisdom in each session. These 10 mins a day have put me back in the habit. You will find good sleep stories,guided mediations and amazing music here!
title: Love it!

review: I only wish that Calm would diversify the  voices and narrators for the daily meditations. Having the same person for all of them is a bummer, especially because her voice is kind of annoying. Some voices just are for some people, and for others they are perfect, which is why I would love it if Calm used different voice actors for that section, they way they do with the sleep stories. Other than that, I love Calm! Highly recommend it! Use it almost everyday. üôÇ
title: Wonderful sleep Stories

review: Going through peri menopause has me experiencing many emotions which isn‚Äôt connected to any specific stressors of life. The only thing I can attribute this stress to are the hormones which are a little unbalanced at this time in my life. The Calm app keeps my mind relaxed, it gives me a break from thinking or over thinking things and during the times that my body is tight and stressed from head to toe the Calm app is there to remind my mind how to  ‚Äùbreathe‚Äù and ‚Äútake a mind break‚Äù. I highly recommend it!
title: Stress reliever for those raging hormones!

review: I really am loving this app, I use it every day for a.m. meditation and music to keep me less stressed during the workday. I love that they keep adding new music. My one annoyance, and the reason I only gave four stars, is because they only allow you to choose a female voice for most of the meditations. In my personal experience, I find I do better with a male voice, and I wish they give that option more often. Some of the meditations allow you to choose between a male and a female voice, and I think all of the meditations should do that.
title: More voice choices

review: I really love this App. It has helped me learn how to meditate and I can see how meditation helps me. I look forward to meditating every day. I would give this app 5 stars except for Tamara Levitt, her voice is on almost every guided meditation and there are no other options or very few options. For someone who is supposed to be guiding people though a meditation, she talks a lot. Just when I am getting into the meditation, she interrupts repeatedly. It is very frustrating and I have stopped my practice before the program is finished because of this. I will probably not renew my subscription when it comes due if this continues.
title: Meditation

review: This app really changed my life. I‚Äôm prone to panic attacks and listening to this app is the only thing I‚Äôve found to really get them under control so I don‚Äôt live in fear. Highly recommended for anyone struggling with panic and anxiety! And the background scenes and sleep stories are so soothing to listen to at night. Only one silly complaint: Tamara, please, PLEASE stop saying ‚Äúwiggle your fingers and toes‚Äù at the end of your meditations. Something about it is so irksome. I can‚Äôt be the only one who‚Äôs bothered by it! üòÇ But other than that, AMAZING!
title: Amazing for panic attacks

review: I absolutely love this app!  I originally didn‚Äôt pay for the upgrade and listened to the same sleep story every night for about 2 months. Then I realized how much the Calm app was helping me sleep. Now I don‚Äôt go to bed without it!!  I love being an adult who falls asleep to someone reading to me!!  It‚Äôs fantastic!!!  The only thing I wish it had was a thing (a star or check mark) telling me I‚Äôve listened to a story already. Otherwise, I have absolutely nothing bad to say. I can‚Äôt remember sleep so good before the app. Thank you Calm!!
title: Love it!!

review:
Relax as you calmly drift off to a peaceful sleep with Calm...it works wonders! I have been sleeping much better lately since I downloaded Calm. And I need beauty sleep! Anyway, listen to stories that are so serene, they make you fall asleep in a sentence of them. The Calm songs have a relaxing beat to them that you can just lie there, listening to music, or just drift off to a relaxing sleep! 
Calm, thank you for everything you do, we love you, always, and hope you keep updates going. You have my moral support. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Calm For All

review:
For an app that is supposed to create calmness this app sure does cause a lot of stress and annoyances. 

First songs do not always load when clicked on. Often times I‚Äôm having to close out the app and reopen it in order to play the song/sounds I want. Second. The UI is way too cluttered after the UI change. No quick access to my favorites and way too many categories and too much going on. 

Clean up the interface. Simple is better especially for a calmness app. Fix your ongoing problem of songs not loading. That should be a basic operation of a music playing app.
title: App continues its decline

review:
The calm app is one of the best resources you will ever come across. There are so many ways to use it. The lessons learned are insightful and encouraging. It‚Äô s like having a new best friend that you can access no matter the time of day. It has definitely helped me learn how to deal with anxiety. My sleep has improved as well. I love the sleep stories, the meditations, the daily meditations, and all of the other applications. It‚Äôs always being updated.
Do yourself a favor and give it a try. You‚Äôll be happy you did!
title: Calm app

review:
I have yet to find a similar app that resonates with me as much as this one. I use it everyday. As someone with GAD and Bipolar 2, it helps to have an app like this...

PROS: setup reminder notifications, ever-changing daily meditations, learning opportunities, soothing music, daily check-ins, a couple nice sleep stories (the Harry Styles one is ridiculously affective).

CONS: High cost (I think it‚Äôs worth it but money is tight and I almost didn‚Äôt get the app), mostly just 1 voice/meditation guide to listen to (I like Tamara, but I do wish I could hear other voices and different meditation styles), few sleep stories to choose from.

I would also suggest expanding upon the capacity of the calendar. The calendar only remembers 1 check in per day. Sometimes I do multiple check-ins per day, but the calendar doesn‚Äôt reflect that. 

All in all, I LOVE this app and highly recommend it. Thank you!!!
title: A life changer

review:

title: Almost perfect

review: I was excited when I saw this app on the Today Show as I suffer from anxiety and sleep problems and was very very disappointed that the free version basically offers nothing. Please know this before you download. You don‚Äôt have access to the sleep stories except maybe two. You don‚Äôt have access to meditations other than the beginning to a series. You don‚Äôt have access to the relaxing sounds. You‚Äôre not even able to open your daily meditation. This app could be a powerful tool to those that need it, but not everyone that needs this app has the money to pay for it and I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair to advertise this app to people who can not afford the care.
title: Very sad and disappointed

review:
My first review of this app was filled with praise for its well-designed interface and content. That still rings true! Total
You‚Äôll be impressed from the start! The bigger, more important, picture is how transformative the content of the app can be for your life and for the lives around you! Not only do I benefit greatly from the mediations, music selections, and master classes, but the students benefit from having a teacher with a more mindful outlook on life.  I cannot thank you enough for this experience!
title: Life changing!

review:
I received a calm subscription as a school initiative, and have definitely taken advantage of all things Calm! I have now been practicing for about 6 months and have noticed myself being able to identify emotions as they arise, sleep better/earlier, and a sense of inner peace when I practice more than once a day. 
The app also has a great way to track your progress, see streaks, and check in with yourself each time you practice to notice any changes. 
I really enjoy this app!
title: 6 months practice... AMAZING results!

review:
This is a helpful tool for the day-to-day challenges of life. It brings awareness to the importance of applying mindfulness to all we do, however mundane it may appear to be at that moment. It raises consciousness and makes living be intentional. Every aspect of our life on Earth becomes equally precious by eliminating the boring and the unimportant. 
I find myself no longer trying to avoid what I used to view as uncomfortable or even wasteful. Everything and everyone has a purpose and it‚Äôs up to the individual to acknowledge that.
title: Helpful

review:
I love the idea behind this. The sleep stories are the best part, especially since you have a wide variety of voices to choose from.  Unfortunately, they almost always use the same two or three female voices for all of the meditation and daily calms, so if those voices and speaking patterns (like drawn out ‚Äús‚Äù sounds, over enunciated consonants and odd tone/inflections) grate on your nerves rather than soothe, there are entirely large chunks of the app that won‚Äôt work for you and absolutely no where but here in a review to comment on it. . . 
The master classes are nice too, but there are not as many of those.
title: Some parts are better than others

review: I do really like calm. It is a little frustrating how they keep minimizing the lite version of it. There used to be five stories you could listen to without premium, but now there is only one. I mainly use it for background noise (rain, water, etc.) but sometimes I like to hear a story and now it‚Äôs just the same one on repeat. I don‚Äôt use it enough to activate a premium account. So if you use it often and really delve into it, I would recommend a premium account. It is still a nice app to have however just for once in a while uses!

Realizing my mind wanders pretty easily I wanted to act on it and when I read online I found meditation is best way to control your mind. Searching for sources to learn how to Meditate I felt that something like an app that can help me to start meditating and here I am now. I recommend this app. I started 30 day meditation course and I am hoping to achieve better results.

review: I own a sleep number bed and had been getting horrible numbers at night when I slept. I started using this app and my sleep has improved by over 15 numbers per night. I have less tossing, less getting up, and less stress. I listen to music at least 30 min before sleep to help relax. One thing I like the most so far, is that it keeps playing all night until I turn it off. Very happy with it. I purchased the yearly program. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
title: Works amazing

I was blown away and could of sworn he hypnotized me or something because I have never been able to ever fall asleep as fast and as sound as I did. I listen to it every single night. I couldn‚Äôt tell you what the story is really about or the end of it because I am OUT by at least half way through. I love this app so much and I am very pleased with the purchase and even the cost. Love love love love love!!!!!
title: GAME CHANGER!!!!!!!

review: I have had uncontrollable epilepsy for the last 6 years after being seizure free for 30. A friend recommended that I try the Calm app and I have physical proof that it works; at least for me. A recent weeklong study of my seizures was really causing me a lot of stress. The doctor asked me if I could calm down. I closed my eyes and took three deep breaths and then followed my breath. The doctor was shocked! My read out completely changed to a steady calm rhythm. It became my ‚Äútrick‚Äù that I had to repeat when anyone came into my room!
title: Instant calming effect

review: This app saved my life. Other apps are nice and help a bit but this one is a completely different level. So happy with this! Yes I did have to pay, but it was worth it. From my crippling anxiety, ptsd and insomnia, this is everything. Helped with mindfulness while falling asleep, very effortlessly. Other apps it feels like I have to try harder, but this just lulls you into getting better. This app is the equivalent of a hug and makes me feel like a kid again, being comforted. Puts me in the best headspace ever I love it.

title: Amazing

review: I LOVE this app it really helps me  get through tough things and reminds me how amazing my life is. The only thing I don‚Äôt like about this app is that you can only get a limited amount of things . Most of the things that I can‚Äôt get are things I really need . Other wise I would recommend this app to ANYONE it‚Äôs kid friendly and there are some things for adults . I‚Äôm just 12 and I  had an English teacher recommend it for me . I absolutely can go on and on about how much I love this app !üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ
title: üëçüèª

review: My first experience with this app was very disappointing. I wrote about my original problems, mostly being that the app was entirely concerned with getting $70 dollars out of someone who was seeking a cheaper substitute to other sleep remedies. After writing my original post, I was sent an ad for 40% off. It‚Äôs wonderful to see that the app developers way of helping their customer was to just have them pay for a $40 app. You could only imagine how comforting it was to see that the remedy to my disappointment was to still spend an entire weeks worth of grocery money o  an application to help me sleep better, especially during this stressful pandemic. The lack of empathy in this company is truly staggering.
title: Hilarity ensues

review: This is a great app with great content that will really help you become a better version of yourself if you truly intentional invest. I see so many complaints about a lot of the content not being free but with all the stuff people waste their money on that doesn‚Äôt help better themselves, this is an investment. Great and more than enough free content if that‚Äôs what you prefer but i have the lifetime subscription and it‚Äôs well worth the little over 5$ a month.
title: Great App/Invest in your wellness

review:
I just re-checked this app after a couple years away, and there are some amazing updates that I absolutely love. 

However unfortunately 95% of the meditations are STILL only one person Tamara, who has a grating voice with an affected ‚Äúvocal fry‚Äú. I don‚Äôt understand why the app still doesn‚Äôt offer various different voices, they say she is their ‚Äúhead of mindfulness‚Äú but her a voice is like nails on a chalkboard.

Only 3 meditations have a male alternative Jeff and his voice is great, very listenable and soothing, but this isn‚Äôt enough content to make me pay. 

I‚Äôm also surprised that I still can‚Äôt search by length of meditation, for example today I want to do a 20 minute meditation and there‚Äôs no way to search for that. 
 
Really disappointed as (unlike many whining angry reviewers) I am ready and happy to pay $70 for a meditation app, and I wish it could be this one. I think having one person do all of the meditation is a mistake. Offer more options. We‚Äôre not all going to be able to stand listening to a weirdly affected way of speaking.
title: Can‚Äôt stand the voice

review: I have the free app, an older version and I absolutely love the scenes option. There are a few that I use for meditation. However, on my newest device, I have downloaded calm in order to access scenes. Sadly, it is no longer an option. :( The 7 day meditation is also no longer free. Bummer. I have considered purchasing the yearly however, without the scenes, I cannot. I honestly don‚Äôt need rain sounds. I love the grounding sounds with the scenes option... still a great app for some people. I refuse to use the latest version as it no longer contains scenes.
title: Bring back ‚ÄúScenes‚Äù with the newer version!

review: This app is amazingly useful. I read about it and always wanted to try but the price was holding me back! I tried the free trial version and enjoyed it fully. Great help for beginners. There are stories, different meditation modes etc. that helps you calm. I finally purchased it as promo from one of my credit card and I am loving it. I started using when I needed extremely. As I used it I realized this must be use on daily basis. Anyone who wants to calm and meditate must try this.
title: Must have.

review: I never leave reviews....ever.... But as someone who's been dealing with anxiety most of my life and the crazy obsession of overthinking myself into panic attacks and depression, I needed a change. And believe me when I say THIS IS LIFE CHANGING. For the first time in...probably ever.... I am beginning to think clear and calm. I look forward every day to using this app. If you‚Äôre suffering from mental debilitation of any kind please give this app a try and be open to its ability to help you, because I promise you, it will.
title: Wooowww

review: In theory this app sounds like a great idea. This app was not what I expected nor what I have seen advertised. I have been on the 7 day trial and have been using it before bed to help me sleep. I like that you have the ability to set sleep timers for the soundscapes and meditation, however I tried multiple sounds and most of them stopped within 10 mins on their own (even though I had a timer set for an hour, 1.5 hours). So getting pulled out of relaxation just as you‚Äôre starting to fall asleep is a bit jarring. I definitely won‚Äôt be spending $80 on this app.
title: Not what I expected

review:
As best I can tell, the app is fine, but the fact that there is a ‚Äúfree‚Äù version that has locked 99.9% of the content should just... make you pay to even look at it. I found exactly one thing that didn‚Äôt require the subscription service, a ‚ÄúSleep Story‚Äù by Stephen Fry (a very nice sleep story, mind you.) 
There is nothing else without paying money, so don‚Äôt bother ‚Äútesting‚Äù the app, just expect to spend money to even get a feel for the content. The free subscription trial is 7 days, and seems to suggest that even if you turn off auto renew, they‚Äôll ‚Äúhelpfully‚Äù turn it back on. Hope it works out for you, just wasn‚Äôt a good first experience
title: Why even have a free version?

review: I am just starting to use this App and I must say it seems that it is truly working for me.  I have tried several ways to treat my anxiety and sleep but nothing worked.  For first time last night I used the sleeping bedtime book as I read where someone said it put them to sleep in five minutes - I said it would not do that for me as I again, tried everything so I tried & I believe I feel asleep in less that five minutes!!üòä. I‚Äôm loving this App - Thank you
title: Calm

review:
This has been one of the most useful apps to aid with sleeping. The options are great and are perfect for providing background noise that is also calming. 

My only complaint is the time limits jump from 4 to 8 hour increments. Six hours would be perfect as the sudden silence in the middle of the night wakes me up with the 4 hour setting, and 8 hours makes it harder to want to get out of bed! Seriously, help a sister out and add that on the next update. Thanks!
title: Great for helping with sleep!

review: I love the daily check-in especially since it allows you to let all of your emotions flow freely and it's private so only you can see it. I like the emojis that can represent moods, but please add more like "Passionate", "Powerful", and "Scared". The stories are mostly premium, but you can get by with what you have alone! Please add the daily check-in to ads because I think people will want to let their emotions free by writing down what they  think. Thank you! 100% recommend!
title: Excellent!

review: I took the first opportunity when there was a discounted offer, to purchase a lifetime subscription. This app has literally kept me afloat during this pandemic. I have suffered from chronic insomnia and anxiety and my mental health has benefited SO much from the check-in meditations and body scans, especially at bedtime. The sleep stories are great. I fall asleep every single night to softly falling rain and Tamara reminding me to focus on my breath and not my worries. This app has really been a lifesaver for me. Tamara is a national treasure!
title: Lifetime Member

review: I previously reviewed this app stating that I love it and it‚Äôs helpful. I still feel that it is, however I‚Äôve been pulling away from it because the content that updates isn‚Äôt something I‚Äôd use or use to help me fall asleep. The stories are great, and the Daily Calm topics are helpful if you need them. But what I need is to sleep. PLEASE add more sleeping music, not soundscapes, not stories. PLEASE add music that‚Äôs going to repeat. My renewal will be approaching soon. I‚Äôm not sure if I want to renew for another year...
title: New Review

review:
This is the app I've found the easiest to use for learning to meditate. I've also used Headspace, and I found this better for learning.

One thing I don't get... why is that the app's weekly meditation tracker starts on Sunday and its mood tracker starts on Monday??? I wish these would sync up and both start on the same day (and that we could choose which day of the week to start our calendars, as I prefer to start on Monday, like the international standard).
title: Best app for learning to meditate

review: I adore Calm! I‚Äôve been using it for about a year now, almost daily. My favorites are the sleep stories, especially the ones that take place on a train or in another country. And I love how the narrator is usually from that country! I can‚Äôt imagine my life without Calm now. I even had to email their costumer service to ask a complicated question and they were fast to reply, very respectful, and very helpful. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this company. I‚Äôm so impressed.
title: Love Calm!

review: I have been on a journey for a couple of years now to find happiness and peace. I found the calm app a little over a year ago and love it from the start. However a few months ago I started taking meditation more seriously and increased my sessions to multiple times daily. The calm app allows you to tailor your journey in whichever way you like. The guided meditation sessions are soothing and really teach valuable lessons in life. Definitely worth the money for me.
title: One of the best apps of 2020

review: The Calm app has become my way of attending church. These meditations, sleep stores and soundscapes have helped me to connect to myself and curate discipline and self love. Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice brings me to the present moment time after time. I am eternally grateful for the effort and care that goes into every aspect of Calm. Plus the Instagram story addition has allowed me to share some of my lessons and blessings with my network and I hope it has helped at least one person in turn. Thank you.
title: My respite

review: The content in the app is great which is why I gave four stars.  I did the free trial because I really like the calm ads...the Facebook ad that looks like a tunnel in space, the tv ad with the video of rain and the blue circle that times 30 seconds. I find them so relaxing and was disappointed to find that the app didn‚Äôt include anything like that. If there was a section that included the content from the ads and other things similar to it, I would pay for a subscription.
title: I like the ads better than the app

review:
Use Calm daily. Sleep stories help me sleep and soundscapes are great for concentration for work or relaxation.  

Create Sleep Stories Playlist please, please, please! This way you can listen to multiple stories in a row without having to manually select it. Restarting the story every time I wake up so the story doesn‚Äôt end really is disrupting. 

For very light sleepers that wake up at any change in sound, continuous play of sleep stories would be helpful.
title: Playlist NEEDED for Sleep Stories !!!

review: I am subscribed because i just really wanted to try the other ones and it works so good there is so much other stuff then just sleep‚Ä¶. During the day i do some breathing exercises and listen to the music of there and when im having a hard time trying to sleep i just pick a story put it under my pillow and im asleep in 2 min‚Ä¶. When you play the music you can't put a sleep timer and set for however long you want. I usually put mine for 3 hours
title: AWSOM I LOVE IT SO MUCH

review: I‚Äôve wanted to subscribe for a long time and recently found a subscription discount.  So glad that I finally joined.  The app layout is simply elegant  and well designed.  Easy to explore the many features  and content of the app and find what might interest you next.  Graphics are fantastic.  I think the sleep time stories are probably great, but I really don‚Äôt know since I‚Äôve fallen asleep fast, and that is the point to the story.
title: Elegant app design and content rich

review: The application design is good. The app works nearly flawlessly. However the service is expensive, and most of the content is blah at best, such as a person in a soothing voice telling you how to relieve anxiety with suggestions you could get from a google search. Some of the content is good, such as the music selection but overall you could probably do better elsewhere. I joined through a special offer through my AmEx card. I cancelled the 1/2 price auto renewal since I find I am not using it anywhere near enough to justify the expense.
title: Technically outstanding.  Content is meh.

review:
This is my third year with a premium subscription to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù. I have really enjoyed it and recommended it over and over again. 
Lately, and when I say lately I mean for at least a month, it has been opening at completely random times. I can be talking on the phone and the Wizard of Oz pops up. I can have my phone sitting on the console with a podcast on and all of a sudden  Calm is playing.
I have deleted the app and reinstalled it. That does nothing. Just now on the phone with a client a meditation began. 

I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs happening but it‚Äôs not pretty! Ready to go to the social media route and shout to the masses!
title: App randomly opens with no prompting

review:
My husband suffered a stroke and my whole life crumbled    After a short time,  I was under tremendous stress 
And everyone A banded me exception of my aunt.  When I was at my darkness Matthew McConaugheys voice kept me alive.   The more I learned about the app the more I was able to get though yet another day.  
I now feel this app is just as important as water for me and my kids.   Thank you from the bottom of my heart.  Truly greatful for the app and that Matthew McConaughey saved my life.
title: Kept me alive literally

review: Honestly, the concept of this app seems so gimmicky to me- a way to cash in on the growing mental health care awareness, but my guys - it works! I have never fell asleep so quickly and slept so soundly, the sound of Matthew McConaughey reading me a bedtime story just worked. I love the guided meditations, and using the white noise feature. If you have any troubles sleeping I can almost promise you this will help. I also love that you can have the app playing without needing to worry about the screen shutting off.
title: I love this APP

review: I have struggled with sleep for 6 months.  I started listening to music to help me sleep but it wasn‚Äôt truly relaxing.  I knew I needed to try to be more mindful about letting go and knowing my body‚Äôs responses to stress. I haven‚Äôt wanted to take drugs other than melatonin.  Once I tried Calm my life changed instantly.  Every day I felt better and better.  My sleep is more sound.  I‚Äôm meditating and monitoring my mood daily.  I‚Äôm taking care of myself with Calm.  Thank you so very much!
title: Life changing

review:
I loooove this app but I‚Äôm begging for a feature.
Pleeeeease add the function to create a personalized playlist. It will help prevent me from seeing what time it is on my phone when I need to start a new story or some music or meditations. 
On my worst insomnia nights, nothing is more anxiety inducing that a sleep story coming to an end. 
I‚Äôd love to create a lineup of stories and meditations to get me through without having to scroll, look at bright light, and accidentally see the time. 
Xoxoxo
title: Kudos and request

review: Was trying to handle an incredible amount of stress and this app was mentioned on a docuseries I happened to be watching.  It was an amazing introduction to meditation which I would have probably never otherwise considered.  It‚Äôs changed my life in the short few months I‚Äôve used it.  The calm masterclasses are also a great resource to enjoy on my walks and I hope the continue to make more of them.  This is the first time I‚Äôve ever felt compelled to review an app before.
title: Helps reduce stress

review: Great app with lots of offerings. I haven‚Äôt been disappointed by any of my selections in the year + I have been using it. Regular, daily updates keep things fresh, but the favorites are always there. Whether I‚Äôm waking up with the Dailly Calm, putting my son down for a nap with Thomas or just putting on some ambiance to help me work, I use this app multiple times a day. There are few things I truly use every day on my phone. This is one of them.
title: Great app for meditation and sleep

review:
I‚Äôve had this app for a little over two years, and the yearly subscription you pay for this app is definitely worth it! They have sleep music, for all kinds, sleep meditation, and all sorts of different kinds of sub categories you can chose from for your guided meditations. 

I never meditated before this app, but this is a really good starter app if you‚Äôve never meditated before, it was really easy for me to start this up. Wonderful app, and love the way it‚Äôs laid out!
title: Amazing

review: I have tried to use this app and it kept shutting down only a second after I open it.  I deleted it for a while and then reinstalled it a month or so later and it worked fine until the meditation music let randomly playing in the background without prompting or even the app being open. The only way I could stop it was to turn off the phone. I eventually deleted the app as it kept going off during my zoom calls. Seriously please figure out what is going on so I can start using it again. I have another meditation app I can use in the meantime.
title: Random music playing from Calm app???

review: First let me say that I love, love , love this app.  I have had problems sleeping and this app is awesome.  It puts me to sleep quickly.  HOWEVER, the recent constant crashing and restarting of the app is starting to just plain aggravate me before I go sleep. It will crash on me 4 or 5 times a night. This started recently. Any ideas on how to fix? I have deleted the app and downloaded it again. Still having same problems. I love this app and I am seriously bummed that I pay for it and it is not working correctly.
title: App issues

review: My 13 year old son & I used the free features to meditate & calm down for years. He loves this app. My husband uses it to help him fall asleep. I loved this app so much I bought a subscription a couple of years ago. I have regularly used the app, since, and have recently purchased the lifetime subscription. I appreciate it for it's wide selection of free options and the apps ability to utilize multiple senses to support mindfulness practice. It is worth it! ü•∞
title: Very well made & liked

review: I had a membership included with Kaiser. Fantastic! It‚Äôs helped me immensely get through the stress of the pandemic. Just find a quiet space in your house and give it a few minutes each day. After a whole you will be surprised how it starts to ‚Äúreset‚Äù you and your ability to stop your mind from wandering to places you don‚Äôt want it to. Thank you Kaiser and thank you Calm!
title: This really works- just go with it for a little while and it gets easier

review:
I bought the lifetime version of the app after discovering their 30-day program on how to meditate with Jeff. It‚Äôs a fantastic program! I highly recommend it!
Only then did I realize that 90% of the other programs are narrated by Tamara, whose smiling while talking makes it impossible (for me) to listen to. She comes across as phony.  I know, I know, meditating should enable me to ignore this, but I don‚Äôt know yet how to do it, and learning from Tamara is just not happening. 
Please, Calm, continue developing your offering, and get other narrators because right now your value proposition is much lower than your competitors‚Äô.
title: Can‚Äôt wait for new programs *not* narrated by Tamara

review:
I have been using this app to help teach mindfulness while going through therapy for some mental issue. It has reduce my anxiety or at least help me shorten the attack by a lot. I‚Äôm not out of the woods but this has help teach me how to see bluer skies.
I did decide since I now have used it daily for almost a year to go with the lifetime membership. I use the meditation, the music, the stories, and my favorite the quick relief hybrid of breath exercises with body scans.
title: It has helped my recovery.

review:
This app has been a savior to me this year. The sleep stories help me fall asleep soundly and stay asleep. This has made a huge improvement in my ability to rest during the night and my alertness and outlook during the day. I had previously tried Headspace but it didn‚Äôt work for me at all; for whatever reason Calm does the trick. 

My only request is to increase the diversity of narrators, and enable some of the sorting features other reviewers have suggested. 

There is just one narrator (Tamara Levitt) who has an extremely affected way of speaking that I find off-putting. She is unfortunately the same person who narrates most of the meditations which has kept me from exploring that part of the app. 

Aside from that, I am a big fan of Calm and think it‚Äôs well worth a subscription.
title: Amazingly effective for sleep

review:
I used to love this app. It relaxed me, calmed my nerves, and let me breathe. And I was able to do a lot of that stuff because it was free. 

Well, I just re-downloaded this app, expecting it to maybe be the same. I open the app, and almost EVERYTHING that is not for beginners is LOCKED. Almost all of the music is locked, all the stories, everything. I haven‚Äôt been this disappointed in an app in a long time. 

Please make more stuff on your app free, it‚Äôd be greatly appreciated. And I know a lot of those funds go to your app, but come on, everything being locked?? That‚Äôs ridiculous. Be better.
title: Used to love this app a few years ago, just redownloaded...

review: Ive been using Calm for a couple of years now and also recommend it to my health coaching clients and friends.  There is a meditation for everything! Their sleep stories are also great.  I also love the mood check in and gratitude journal built Into the app, and the reflections on the daily calm meditations.  Really gives you the opportunity to expand your mindfulness practice.  There have been down days when this app has helped me tremendously.  Thank you Calm!
title: So worth it!!

review: Okay, straight up, I don‚Äôt even use the meditation. All I use is the sleep stuff. GAME CHANGER. I don‚Äôt even know how it‚Äôs possible but ever since I put on the Ocean Waves and keep it playing all night as I sleep, I SLEEP THROUGH THE NIGHT! How is that even possible? I used to wake up countless times. I don‚Äôt even get up to go to the bathroom anymore I sleep straight through until morning. We are all built differently but for me this absolutely changed my life. Thank you Calm!!
title: I can‚Äôt even tell you

review: It takes too long for the meditations to begin. Too much talking not much breathing and relaxing. I appreciate the thought that many may not have any background in meditation. But, maybe there should be a beginners to meditation. Two minutes introductions in an 11 minute meditation is far longer than necessary. Sit, close your eyes, inhale, exhale. .... I‚Äôm torn if I should bother to buy after my free 7 day trial. I do find there to be advantages to this app. But, not when it comes to the guided meditations. Which isn‚Äôt that the main point of this app?
title: A little less set up and more meditation

review: It takes me ages to fall asleep but now I can go to sleep earlier! I love it! Also I fall asleep in 3 mins! It‚Äôs great! This app is recommended for everyone who needs to fall asleep faster! I love this app so much! I don‚Äôt know how much to thank the creators of this app! Know wonder this game is called calm ! It‚Äôs a stress reliever! Anyone who knows or seen this app  should get it! It does not cost money ! And I have not played it in a while but I think there is NO adds! It‚Äôs amazing ! Get this app now!
title: This app is OUTSTANDING ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüåüüåüüåüüòçüòç

review: We bought the premium subscription as our whole family loves to listen to meditation to fall asleep. We were very disappointed to find out that there is no way to repeat a meditation or story. We had previously been using Moshi for my daughter (which has a repeat option). Sometimes it takes her a long time to fall asleep and the repeat feature is necessary. Otherwise we love the app. Please add this feature as it would be a great customer enhancement.
title: Great app but needs a repeat option

review:
A search feature would be nice. While skimming through stories, music, etc., it would be nice to find one you‚Äôve seen without scanning through them all again. I realize making an item a favorite is a way to collect them for oneself. If search is there, please tell me where to find it.

A support feature to report problems, ask questions, etc. would also be great. Again, if a support link is there, please tell me where.

Thank you.
title: Search Feature/Support Feature

review: I am really enjoying this app in every way but one. I always fall asleep before the end of a story which is great but sometimes I awake in a few hours and want to just hold on to my sleep by finishing the story. However there is no easy way to complete or replay that story. I have to come out of where I am in the app and go through the list of stories again.  This makes me now fully awake and sometimes I don‚Äôt find the story I want.  That is frustrating at a time when I want to be relaxed.
title: Almost perfect

review: This app has been a god send during these anxious times, and I am sleeping better than ever. I would really love to see a greater variety of soundscape sounds on the app, adding to those such as the city streets and heavy rain. It would also be great if we could make our own soundscape mixes from the different sounds on offer, blending different noises and different levels to our own preferences. This was a key feature of the old app Ambiance, which no longer exists, but would be most welcome here!
title: Please consider soundscape mixing!

review: Calm is ok.  There are tons of locked content and this app isn‚Äôt worth $70 a year for premium content. Super expensive. There are other apps that let you alter sounds, for example, if you listen to the thunderstorm sound but want more thunder and wind sounds and less lightning - there‚Äôs a sound app that lets you do that. Calm does not have this feature.  Other apps let you increase volume for certain sounds within the sound. Louder thunder, as an example. Those apps are more versatile to a person‚Äôs taste in sounds. Call doesn‚Äôt do this. It‚Äôs an uninstall for me.
title: Missing features

review: Yes hello , this app is amazing don‚Äôt get me wrong but i have a few questions. Just a few days before ,the songs and soundscapes were available and I could listen to them but now all of a sudden I can‚Äôt listen to them because they are all locked and I can only listen to the songs I downloaded. I‚Äôve had this app for years and this has never happened before. Do I need to pay for the subscription? Was there an error? Please respond. Edit: now I can‚Äôt even access my downloaded songs! It‚Äôs empty; it says I didn‚Äôt download any but I just listened to the downloaded songs earlier today! What is wrong? Please respond
title: PLEASE RESPOND. THANK YOU

review: Calm recently locked the 5 and 10 minute timed meditation which previously was part of the free version offering. I had a paid subscription but never used the full app so I went back to the free app to save some money. Calm could: 1. Become a paid app and only have a limited free trial 2. Provide a tiered plans so people can pay for what they use or 3. Introduce random limits to shame people into paying for the app. In return I could: 1. Pay for the app even though I don‚Äôt use most of the features 2. Work around the random, arbitrary limits and keep using the app or 3. Delete the app and move on. Looks like we both choose option 3.
title: I thought the point of meditation was to not force things

review: I would like the daily calm to have different narrators or at least a choice. I do not think I will continue next year unless I can hear another person after 365 days.  It is a wonderful app but I will search for another wonderful app if needed.  I have no particular problem with the narrator but variety in voice for daily listens seem an important way to encourage consistency.   Loving kindness and hopeful improvement and no mean spirit intended.
title: Listen every day

review: I began using this app at the urging of a nutritional health coach when I was diagnosed with an auto immune disease. I have never been great at managing stress! The guided meditations help me so much! I found meditating to be overwhelming and as though I had to do it ‚Äúright. Calm makes it easy and gives you bite sized chunks of mindfulness. Even my children use this app at night with the sleep stories, they alternate between the same two stories every night! The subscription is worth every penny!
title: Exceptional

review: To echo what so many have said, this app has changed my life in just a short month. After doing the free trial and trying some other meditation apps, I found myself always coming back to Calm and decided it was definitely worth the money. Meditating was doctor recommended for me, but it is helped my mental and emotional health just as much  as my physical health and I‚Äôm so thankful to have an app that can help me on the road to recovery. Cannot day enough good things!
title: The best app ever created

review: As a child I grew up without a television. We were a large farming family in the upper Midwest. Rather than fight with us to do our chores or homework my parents opted to not have a TV. Instead my Mother read series of books to us (excellent reader) before bedtime with popcorn and homemade grape juice. It was my favorite thing we did as a family. It relaxed us and helped settle us down for the night just like the readings and soothing sounds of rain on this Calm App. Thank you..
title: Being Read To..

review:
I love this app. I lost my husband, uncle and mother all in the last 4 months. This app has helped me to sleep and get me through some tough days.   Keep up the great work. 
One suggestion I have is I‚Äôve missed updating my daily moods and would
like to be able to go back and add a mood and a little description for that day. I haven‚Äôt been able to figure out how to do that so I‚Äôm thinking the app doesn‚Äôt have that as an option.
title: Best app in these trying times

review: As a yearly paid subscriber it gets hard to want to do the meditations with only Tamara Levitt as the narrator. I personally do not find peace or calm in her voice. I get it‚Äôs her app etc. however if she wants to retain customers on a year to year basis *choice* is a necessary way to win people over. More voices, all genders/binaries and tones are needed to truly reach people. I can‚Äôt see justification in paying for this again when I can‚Äôt focus for ten minutes because her voice doesn‚Äôt resonate with me. It‚Äôs not hard to fix this guys, just a suggestion.
title: More Narrators- Please

review: I have really bad insomnia and this app helps me  wind down and fall asleep- although I don‚Äôt use bedtime stories to fall asleep- I use other sessions like dealing with anxiety and coping topics.. 5 out of 5 (so far)

title: Calm

Anything that helps this is a part of what I call ‚Äú Our emotional evolution.‚Äù

review:

title: Meditating with Calm  JUST DO IT

review: I consciously felt like I physically could not relax. I was constantly quick to anger and frustration. It was really challenging in relationships and managing stress. This app really helped me calm down and slow my mind and body. I actually started being able to breathe better when I‚Äôm finding it challenging from anxiety. I approach situations more calmly. This has been a daily practice for me, and it has really brought me back to how I‚Äôve always envisioned myself.
title: 100mph to 25mph

review: I really like how many options this app has for breathing exercises. I used one of the breathing exercises when I was feeling stressed and overwhelmed and it really helped me calm down. I also really like how many options there are to help with anxiety,m. I just wish that with as many options there are, more were free so I can a fuller experience. I can see though how this would essentially be relaxation training as a form of treatment for anxiety disorders.
title: Relaxing!

review:
Is a 6 Star rating possible? Calm has literally changed my life and my sleep habits significantly. I rely on this app like a family member. title: 6 Stars

review:
This app has help to calm my lambic system several times. Whenever I have anxiety, feel sad, or just looking for a moment for myself this app helps me to come back to balance. 

Remember balance... it is not perfection, it is more the fact you are conscious about your feelings and look for an answer of why you feel them. Let them come with compaction and from there, start going through them to reach peacefulness.
title: Exceptional

review:
I started meditating to preserve a shred of sanity in the pandemic. I purchased Calm Premium and am really happy with it; I love the daily and special meditations, the reminders, the music options, really just a fantastic program for anyone who wants to become less reactive and more accepting.
My only suggestion is to mix up the narrators. Tamara Levitt does an excellent job, but at a certain point it‚Äôs like a radio station with one host. I wouldn‚Äôt change anything about her, but I‚Äôd love some other options.
title: Great app, please mix up the narrators!

review: ... you practice mindfulness daily with this app. I am constantly impressed with the app‚Äôs updates. Every Daily Calm feels like Tamara is touching-base with you. She and the rest of the folks at Daily Calm have been my North Star in my mental health journey. Oh and Yes! The subscription is worth every cent.
title: Life-Changing if....

Tamara Levitt is an Expert in communicating with the unconscious and the collective conscious, and in training our physiology to go Zen. She is a professional who has trekked the long journey and knows how to guide others to inner peace. Spiritually, Tamara is an Angel, she has the soul of someone like Prairie Johnson. title: Tamara Levitt

review: I don't know what I would do without it. I used it in the free mode for sometime before subscribing. It's a simple app to use and has much to offer.
title: Wonderful complete app

review: My birthday is today and I‚Äôm trying to morning mediate everything morning. Tamara‚Äôs voice is soothing and easy to listen to and I‚Äôve mediated now everyday for the last week. Thank you for creating such a wonderful app. It helps me sleep at night and takes my mind out of my thoughts and into just being.
title: Helping let go

review: I started using this three years ago when my Mom passed away, it helped me to cope but I wasn‚Äôt consistent. I have always enjoyed the different categories and availability.
