I‚Äôm on the ‚ÄúHow to meditate‚Äù 30 days masterclass and loving it. The app has always work really well for me on Apple with no glitches.
title: Three years user

review: I had been introduced to this app some years ago at a time when I didn‚Äôt take meditation seriously. Growing up in the Caribbean, the idea of mediation and therapy was almost considered taboo, especially amongst men in the culture. I participated foolishly in these hyper-masculinities only to be torn down emotionally because some compounded trauma. With limited options, I turned to therapy and to Calm. It has been woven into my routine since. It is my go-to when recalibration is needed!
title: Exactly what I needed!

review: I started Calm with a one month free trial. I loved the sessions so much I bought a year subscription. The fact is, I would rather pay $50/year for this than $300 for one therapy session. The full app has many different areas, including meditation, sleep, stress, self-care, etc. the narrators have soothing voices, and the content is excellent. This app is a no brainer for someone looking to enhance their mental health. It has been so effective for me and highly recommend.
title: Premium is WORTH IT

review:
The app is good for what it does.
When you complete a ‚Äòseries‚Äô it doesn‚Äôt save where you were before, so u have to kind of scroll through and remember what was next. This is irritating. The navigation is decent, but needs a revamp to make it more seamless for the user.

The hardest thing to literally listen to, is the voice. While there are some options for an alternate voice, most are just one voice. If this were fixed along with the navigation, I would give the app 5 stars. Will not renew membership.
title: Need other voice options

review: I had to get a 45 minute MRI recently and was terrified.  Someone suggested this app to help me overcome my anxiety and fear. Listening to the confidence in Lebron James voice and his talks really helped me focus...take a deep breath, put on blinders and shut out the noise. Excellent strategy when going into an MRI. Jeff Warren‚Äôs talks taught me how to Meditate and take control of my emotions and prepare my mind for the task at hand. The imagery and sounds made  this a great app for overcoming my anxiety and staying calm in what in was a terrifying situation.
title: I was terrified

review: His How to Meditate & The Daily Trip are completely different than traditional approaches to meditation.  He makes it easy, relatable and most importantly, he keeps it real. Everyone can meditate and make it work and make a difference in their own lives.  His meditations are soul food for mental health.I also find the sleep stories helpful when I‚Äôm having trouble getting to sleep.  They work for me.  Completely worth the yearly fee.

review: I‚Äôve tried many of the meditation apps and Calm is definitely my favorite! Super easy to use and calming interface. Great 10 minute daily meditations with a different focus everyday, I always learn something new! I would definitely recommend this app for anyone interested in meditation.

title: Great app to help calm anxiety

review: This app is good and can really help you fall asleep but there are soooo many thing in there that cost money. I downloaded it and I couldn‚Äôt do much.  Don‚Äôt get me wrong, what was free was good but it wasn‚Äôt much.  There are a ton of really cool looking stories and other stuff but it all cost money.  And I get it, they are trying to make more money for the company, but it‚Äôs too much and there isn‚Äôt enough free thing to do.  Basically, my only problem with the app is it‚Äôs free variety is very small.  Besides that, it is pretty nice and can help you (especially if you got money).

I deal with a lot of anxiety, low self esteem and stress, especially during a pandemic, so I need something to help me. I like the breathing exercises but practically anything else is premium and cost money. I don‚Äôt want to have to spend money just so I can relax and relieve anxiety. Please offer more free features so It can be more available to more people. It‚Äôs so unfortunate that everything has to cost an excessive amount of money especially during a time of economic hardship when people are unable to pay to take a couple minutes to relax because they don‚Äôt have a job due to COVID. Make it more free please.
title: Way too expensive

review: I don't want to have to pay $70 a year for me to be able to do things on there. I wanted to listen to music but there wasn't any that were free. If you could make it where there are some things that are free that would be great. Also for the one of the meditation activities you have on there, only one was unlocked. I was looking forward to doing it but I couldn't. I'm hoping that you could put more free stuff on there for the people who don't want to pay.
title: Don't want to pay

review: Every aspect of this app was created to help each of us learn to be kind to ourselves resulting in us being kind in the world. It is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù app for many reasons. I use it more often than any other app (even my calendar).  It brings me peace and calm which is the life I chose to lead. I invested in Calm‚Äôs people for a lifetime as I want them to enjoy their work and selfishly so that I can continue to benefit from the gifts they offer all of us. Peace to all.
title: A Better Life

review: I am so proud of myself! I have had this app on my phone for a long time. I am usually too busy or distracted to make it through a single meditation. I did it! 11 minutes went by so fast! I am excited about using this Calm as part of my daily routine! I‚Äôm going to share with a couple of friends that will benefit also. The app was originally suggested to me by my primary doctor. Probably 5 years ago. It takes what it takes!
title: Focus

review: I‚Äôve tried headspace before and it was okay but I think the British accents were a little annoying... I feel that calm has better people leading the meditation and a better program in general.  Also, Calm keeps introducing celebrity speakers for the guided meditation.  It‚Äôs pretty cool.  They also have a bunch of good soundscapes and relaxing music.  I really love this app. I did the one week trial and decided to pay for the year before the trial even ended.
title: Actually helps

review: This app is all about meditation and getting stress out of our minds, but this app can also bring a little stress back to us with in-app purchases. We need to buy a premium version for Calm just to listen and go through premium meditation. When it asks you to buy it, it cost money (obviously) so we have to put all our info. into this app just to buy a pass. That is very stressful. It is also more stressful when you already bought it but you never use it.
title: In-app Purchase Stress

review:
But I seem never to do that. Here's the thing: if I go to bed realizing I won't get enough sleep, I tend to lie there and stew over work stuff. When I launch a sleep story, it removes all the responsibility of work. It's like a real bedtime story, and you don't MEAN to fall asleep, of course.
I have been trying to listen to a description of a great library for at least 3 nights now. I can't do it, no matter how much I try.
title: Hope to finally hear a sleep story...

review: First off why make an app free when you download it and then spam me with 30 month trial only 7.99 a month. App makers like this are scammers only trynna make money and get you to download. It‚Äôs impossible to find a actually free app that doesn‚Äôt spam you to pay money. I am going to tell all of my friends to give this app a 1 star hence all you want is my money. Btw I would feel less cheated if you had to pay off the bat instead of being a free app and realing me in then making me create an email account then answer 20 questions to just be asked pay a monthly subcrition........... ridiculous :((((((((((
title: It a rip off you have to pay!!!!!!!

review: I previously wrote a review about how Calm kept glitching out. I have a new phone, and that might contribute to it. They also might of fixed it. But, having the subscription - even not having it - the amount of content that is available to you is crazy. Every DAY there is something new and I am never bored with the app. They also have mediations and sleep stories narrated by a variety of celebrities. So overall, I love Calm.
title: It‚Äôs Better

review:
After using the Calm app for for four months, my mind senses when I need to relax and my body responds. My should relax, my mind gets quiet, and I automatically concentrate on my breath. 

I feel myself desiring to focus only on the present instead of dwelling on the past or trying to figure out the future. 

Love the variety of ways that I can meditate and the messages that available.  The reminders are very helpful throughout the day.
title: State of Relaxation

review: I wasn‚Äôt too big of a fan of the yearly fee but I figured I would try it for the trial week and see how it went. I was not disappointed. I tried Headspace (which was nice) but a bit too cartoonish for me. Then I tried calm and I must say, it is worth every penny. I use it for med school anxiety and to help me sleep soundly at night. Honestly, I have never reviewed an app before, I thought it was a waste of time, but this one is incredible.
title: First review ever for an app, excellent

review: I really wish they would allow custom playlists, and also Mark which videos you have already played.  I have been using the Favorites button to just heart any ones I‚Äôve watched.. for instance I want to rewatch a meditation series and continue where I left off the day before..  how do easily I do that? Also, I swear I had a favorite train meditation but it‚Äôs not there anymore?  Could be a better way to search videos for author narrator or title?
title: This is great but could be even better!

review: I downloaded the app thinking it would be useful. First thing that pops up is a subscription alert for $70?? Thats already a bad sign. They force you to enroll in a 7 day trial with the hopes that you will forget to unsubscribe, so they can charge you that ridiculous fee. On top of that, almost every app feature is locked if you want to avoid that pathway. I spent some time looking for some content that I could access for free and quickly received an influx of rebuttals indicating to ‚ÄúUnlock Calm‚Äù. I got even more frustrated then what drove me to download the app in the first place and deleted the app.
title: I will CALMLY delete this app

review:
I really like the 7 days of calming anxiety 
It‚Äôs been helpful.  I feel more relaxed and will listen to it everyday.  I actually listen to 3 or more in a row. I am already in the meditative state at that point, so it‚Äôs good to just keep going.  I will try more soon.  It‚Äôs not just for relaxation but it can change beliefs, perspective, reactions etc so I do feel if I keep it up, it may just change my life.  I already do feel a little change and I just started.  
Personal preference. I like to listen to John Armstrong‚Äôs voice. They give you the option.  
I hope they have more meditations in the future with his voice as an option.  
The meditations and content are very effective and powerful. 
I will subscribe for 1 year when the 1 week free trial is up.  It‚Äôs worth it to me
title: Fantastic üòéüëçüèª

review: Calm is a really good app but most of the activities you have to get the premier access which is about 70 dollars.  That really bugs me because the things that look interesting are premier access.  It did really change me from going all mad to calm whenever something frustrates me.  Thank you for reading this and I hope you have more activities for those who don‚Äôt want to pay 70 dollars just to get something really relaxing.  Thank you for reading this and have a blessed day.
title: Good but,

review: This is a wonderful app. My only complaint is that it turns itself on throughout the day. I pause my music so my boss can talk to me and then the Calm app starts playing. I turn off my Bluetooth so I can talk to someone - Calm starts playing. I open an app on my watch completely unrelated to Calm - Calm starts playing. In each of these cases - the Calm app isn‚Äôt even open on my phone or my watch!!!! Annoying and embarrassing.
title: Good app but turns itself on randomly

review: Much better than headspace. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, headspace was revolutionary and the creator and narrator knows what he is doing. What wins me is the sounds playing in the back as soon as you open the app. I‚Äôm a sucker for the sounds of nature and it was long forgotten until I was pleasantly surprised when I first got to the home screen. So far, the lesson I‚Äôve done in Calm, the narrator had a great vibe and was emphatic!
title: Headspace should watch out; different style meditation but much better ipo

review:
I have to say, I only wanted this app for the sleep stories, and since there aren‚Äôt any in the free version, I decided to bite the bullet and pay for the subscription. It was worth it. The interface of the app is beautifully and I love the sleep stories.

I would love another story like Calm Airways; one that‚Äôs not really a story but still has narration. That‚Äôs basically the only story I listen to anymore, it‚Äôs just so lovely.
title: The only premium subscription I‚Äôve ever wanted

review: I‚Äôve really enjoyed this app so far. It‚Äôs got a lot of variety and helped me to start meditating more regularly. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give 5 stars is because I wish they had 2 voice options for each meditation and story. This is because there are some voices that are weird or are distracting (like Tamera which sounds more seductive than calming) so it would be great to have at least 1 other option. Some of the recordings do but a lot don‚Äôt.
title: Got me to start mediating more regularly

review:
Your very hard work was amazing!
So before I entered this app I was playing  another game and they were hogging were I was playing and I got mad I did not enjoy it at all so then I came to this amazing game and it helped me A LOT so I wanted to write this review because I wanted to show you how relaxed I am now. Thank you so much for everything now I am so relaxed this was amazing now I don‚Äôt have to worry about getting mad I just will go to this app! Thank you!!
title: How to Meditate

review: I mostly downloaded this app for the sleep meditations and there are a few that I like from other experts. However, it seems that the creator, Tamara Levitt does the voicing for most of the meditations and a lot of others throughout the app. She seems like an amazing person and I love her backstory, but her voice on the app sounds too fake and like she‚Äôs trying too hard and it makes it difficult for me to feel relaxed. I hope others don‚Äôt feel the same as I do but I just wish there was more diversity with speakers. Or a main voice with a more natural tone. I wont be repurchasing the app.
title: Cannot be calm to Tamara‚Äôs voice

review: I‚Äôm a wife of 49 years this September. A mother of 4 children, the oldest of 46 years old diagnosed with Wilson at the age of 18. That‚Äôs when I stop really caring for myself. Now a grandmother of 5 and one more coming in July, I‚Äôm always trying to help my kids even though they are all married, we truly are living very busy times. So in trying to help I forget myself. Then I realized if I don‚Äôt start now I‚Äôll be 69 this month then WHEN????????thank you CALM for your help.
title: Self care.

review: Hello, I am Ms. Brenda Lee Ann. I believe that this app is tremendously amazing. Im 85 my doctor has prescribed me to wear adult diapers because of my so called potty issues. (I have an issue with defecting in my pants) Well I happened to have a great deal of an issue yesterday while I was going ‚Äúcommando‚Äù or so those young kids call it and I had an accident. I was stressing out over it for about 20 minuets when I remembered I had the Calm app! I immediately opened it and when I listened to a story I was calmed down!
title: Calm

review: Ok so this app might cost a lot, but if you use it wisely trust me there is a huge difference!! I started to use this app because every night I would get panicked and this app helped me cool down and settle myself. It has meditations, sleep stories , and I love how there is many different narrators so you can pick which voice you like. ( all are soothing)  I‚Äôd recommend this app to anybody who has anxiety issues or problems sleeping because it‚Äôs a game changer!!
title: Calm

review: The guided meditations are very well done. Tamara Levitt does an excellent job in her sessions. I also love the wide range of meditation types and for different outcomes (performance anxiety, sleep, stress etc.). I just heard Lebron James‚Äô sessions and I think it was brilliant, using a superstar athlete who uses the practice of meditation to prove the effectiveness and importance it has on your life. Excellent job overall and I can‚Äôt wait to see the future updates
title: This is one of my most important apps on my phone

review: I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever written a review for an app before but it‚Äôs been a year since I downloaded Calm and it‚Äôs legitimately changed my life! Like a lot of people, I was in a pretty bad head space during quarantine 2020, decided to give meditation and this app a chance and between the daily Calms, the specific topic meditations, and the calming music options, I use this app every single day! Well worth the price if you can afford it!
title: Saved my life

review: It's a great app with really helpful guided meditations. It's helped me a lot. However, my one issue with it is that almost all the meditations are voices by Tamara Levitt, and while I'm sure she's a wonderful person and does a great job writing the meditations, I honestly cannot stand her voice. It's so nasally. I pretty much only listen to the meditations that she doesn't do, which eliminates a lot of them. If they had a second voice option for every meditation, I'd 100% give the app five stars.
title: Great meditation app, unfortunate voice

review: Calm is honestly amazing and has helped me through many hard days.  The daily meditations are always great and only 10-12 minutes so you can fit them into your day, and there are cool journaling exercises and a mood check-in so you can do some self-reflection after the meditation.  Highly recommend to anyone who suffers from anxiety, depression, or just wants to get more into meditation at a beginner level.
title: My favorite meditation app

review: The music, stories and meditations on this app are great. But it‚Äôs missing one huge feature IMO and that‚Äôs a sound fade with the timer. If you‚Äôre trying to gently doze off to sleep the sudden cutting off of music or a story is jarring. Ever woken someone up by turning off the tv who had fallen asleep watching? Yea same. The timer is helpful but I either turn it off myself before I fall asleep or it wakes me up when the timer is up. I‚Äôve gone back to my old free app for white noise.
title: It‚Äôs missing one big thing

review: I‚Äôm a chaotic mind racing rapid talking fidgeting explosive neurotic mess. I‚Äôm over engaged in politics and under engaged in self-care. This ap has helped me in days with tension and manic obsessive repetitive behavior, and has certainly peaked my considerable curiosity in exploring further lessons in what the excellent instructors refer to as ‚ÄúThe Practice‚Äù. If my self descriptions above hit a note of familiarity with you, take a few sessions and see how you feel. It‚Äôs worth a shot-
title: If you are curious about meditation: download

review: As someone who wants an accessible and easy way to meditate, listen to white or background noise, or just listen to sleep stories, Calm would be a great solution. I have actually downloaded this app once before, but I deleted it because there were too many locked items, meditations, and stories. Other than this significant issue, Calm is still great for if you just want to listen to background noise. I wish there were more things i have access to without having to pay so much.
title: Too many locked items

And in my iPhone settings there is no such option either. What shall I do? I still have a few months of paid premium account, and being unable to use it is very disappointing!

review: I‚Äôve had the app for a few years. It works great and has wonderful sleep stories and guided meditation. title: Really Good but wish there was more free options

review:
I used to use this app constantly when the meditations weren‚Äôt all locked for paid membership: don‚Äôt get this app if you are looking for free resources. 

The meditations are wonderful but it is just over 5 bucks a month to subscribe (paid on a yearly basis so you cannot cancel early I believe). I‚Äôm sad that they don‚Äôt really have free meditations anymore :/ 

Note* i would subscribe if it wasn‚Äôt a yearly commitment and it was a more reasonable plan for me (subscriptions tend to add up and I‚Äôd like the ability to back out if I need to rearrange finances)

review: I love the design of this app, very clean and pleasing UI, good program...etc. But I ended up having to delete it because the purchase mode is not designed well: It only has 1 option: annual subscription, period. No spot purchases and no packages either. As a very good sleeper I don‚Äôt need all those sleeping aids, all I wanted is music and some meditation exercise. I feel I am being pressed to purchase a lot of things I don‚Äôt need. Product management need to open up a bit about flexibility. There isn‚Äôt just one type of customer for your app!
title: Very Nice Design But...

review:
Not just for meditation there are things for sleep, anxiety, mindfulness, child age range specific meditations, relaxation music/ sounds  scapes, etc...
Many applications and settings for individuals at home.
professionals wanting create and encourage a positive and healthy work environment.
Any person who is in a clinical setting could find some use for the app. Either by using with clients or for their own self care needs as well.
title: Best Self Care App with many applications

review: It made me fall asleep since my the first day I got it,I like how you can change the background and which each background comes a different sound I like the rain one. Please never take this app down
title: Blue Gold, this guy is the best!

title: Love this app

So please add an auto start feature where you can start another story of you aren‚Äôt asleep yet.

review:
I have used Calm as a teacher for a few years now and it changed my classroom life. I always had some calm music playing quietly in the background as my students came into my classroom and while they ate breakfast in the classroom. It always turned our day around! The days I didn‚Äôt use it, were always more chaotic and rambunctious. 
Now I also use it with my own child and it has been a game changer for bed time.
title: Miracle app

review: I am a person who offers grace. I do not like to complain. Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice is not suited for meditation. It is distracting. I have PTSD, and her voice makes me anything but Calm - and every other vocalist in this app is superior. Please make more alternatives. Every meditation I click on I have to back out of because her voice is like a toddler running at your eardrums with rusty nails. Please, do some additional alternating of your artists. title: 5 stars for app, 0 stars for Tamara

review: I think this app really works and is super nice to take bad thoughts off your mind when sleeping. My only issue is the subscription price. It's EXTREMELY overpriced. If it was $30 a year, I think it would be worth it. Until then, I'm sticking to the free subscription until it ends.
title: Great, just really overpriced

review:

Sometimes I lock my phone and the app stops playing even though it‚Äôs still open. For some reason sometimes it does this and sometimes it doesn‚Äôt.

In addition, I try to heart a song and the app doesn‚Äôt respond. Or I‚Äôve hearted a song before and it‚Äôs no longer hearted. I hope some more care can be put into the app.
title: App works inconsistently

review: This is an essential app for anyone in school, stressful situations, unable to sleep, and many other mental issues. The subscription is completely worth it. It also does various guided naps.
title: Best app

The only improvement that I could ask for would be to add the ability to make a ‚Äúsleep play list.‚Äù  Playing 3 or more sleep stories back-to-back would help me get into a deep sleep quicker.
title: Love It!!!

review: i‚Äôve been using this app for two days i think and i already like it. i‚Äôve been doing the sleep meditations and i never get to finish them because i‚Äôve already fallen asleep. I always would usually go to bed around 6 am and only get around two hours of sleep but now i am able to sleep at around 12am which is still late but way better. So if you have trouble sleeping dis is the app for you‚ÄºÔ∏è
title: Great App

review: I have been a paying customer of this app for a few years now and while it‚Äôs a nice app, I had hoped that over the years it could expand the ways you can use it such as a ROKU app to allow it to be streamed on a larger screen like your tv.  Or allow it to be connected to Alexa so I can relax while I do dishes every night.  The visuals and the story are relaxing and I would love it on the TV or other speakers.  For how much I pay, I don‚Äôt enjoy that I‚Äôm stuck to using it on my little phone.  I‚Äôm considering cancelling the app for now but hope they at least make a ROKU tv app in the future.
title: Limited Uses

review: Stress has been a big thing since last year, and thankfully I was able to get the free subscription through Kaiser. It is so so worth it. title: BEST APP TO GET THROUGH THE COVID-19 blues

review: As a  psychotherapist I not only recomend calm to all of my clients but I use it myself.... every day! Many days  I use calm at the end of the work day to meditate and decompress from the day. I use it during the day if I feel anxious by input frm my sessions by doing a progressive body scan. At times I will listen to bedtime stories if I am having a difficult time getting to sleep. It is such a useful app and worth every penny.
title: absolutely the best app I own

review: Calm has quite literally saved my life. I have been a subscriber for years, and it has been with me through relationships, moves, new jobs, and it has been there like a friend throughout all my anxious and depressed moments. I love doing the Daily Calm as often as I can, and the Sleep Stories (especially Harry Styles and the Florida Manatees) help to keep my mind focused on one soothing thing so that it does not wander. I cannot say enough about how great Calm is.
title: A lifesaver

review: I‚Äôm obsessed. I opened this app months ago and couldn‚Äôt commit to the yearly payment; however, I thought to myself that my therapy sessions are $10 less than this app and if I‚Äôm willing to pay some guy to talk to me each month, then certainly I can pay for this app that will help me on my journey to self clarity and gratefulness. I wasn‚Äôt quite ready before, but happy to be here now!
title: Cool App. Truly unlike any other. Kudos to the design team!

review:
So far, I‚Äôm really appreciating the way it changes my mindset. It has come highly recommended by several people and I understand why. 
My only complaint, and the reason I give 4 stars, is because I really dislike the female narrator‚Äôs voice. I won‚Äôt do the daily calm or anything else she‚Äôs narrating because it just irritates me. 
Maybe I need a few months of meditation and I won‚Äôt allow that to bother me anymore.
title: Great, just wish there was another option for the narrator on daily calm

review:

Not so good: sleep story narrators with ‚Äúaffected‚Äù timbre, too fast or high pitched, not relaxing and grates on the nerves
Really bad: App doesn‚Äôt load properly! It takes several times trying for it to finally stay open!! Even when it appears to be open, it isn‚Äôt. It just times out over and over and won‚Äôt open. Takes forever to stay open properly. Maddening!!!

I feel I have finally tapped into the benefits of meditation since using this app. Now it‚Äôs a tool I use whenever I need it.
title: Best meditation app - changed my life

review: As a long haul truck driver living on the road  three weeks out of each month, keeping my sanity is possible. And Calm has been a great help to me. The sleep section and the stories are actually very effective - right to sleep I go. I also like the breathing bubble. Just 5 minutes of breathing of observing thoughts come and go and returning to focus on breath is exhilarating and effective at setting the course of my day. It truly pays to be calmer and not given to neuroticism. Thank you for readingü§†
title: A must have app

This application has definitely help and I see improvement in my attitude with the meditation and sleep sound effects. Like ( rain, snow, forest, ocean, etc.) I would recommend anyone to try this out even if its not because of anxiety, but simply to re-focus and relax your mind and body!. Definitely worth the money.
title: So helpful

review: Calm is like one of the best things that help me calm down I could never doubt calm it helps me with depression and sadness it helps me with so much there is nothing bad I can say bad about this app you need to show calm some love tell family friends this is the most calming apps in the world I mean if your upset or need to calm down or need help going to sleep or really anything‚Äôs that it well calming get on this app I love this app 5 star most definitely
title: ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for the two years since the unexpected death of my husband. It was the only thing that helped me return to a healthy sleeping pattern during the stress of losing him, being isolated by the pandemic and having to shutter my business for months. I continue to find new readers, stories and music that ease me to sleep, help me to sleep more deeply or return to sleep if I wake in the night. Calm has been a life saver for me.
title: Peaceful sleep

review: I was severely depressed at my age 13. I have done something very bad a year ago, I have cryed almost every day of my life because of all the anxiety and guilt building up. I had suicidal thoughts even. Then I downloaded this app, and I got better in time. I learned to live in the present and focus on surroundings and what is happening in my present time. Without this app I would be dead. Thank you so much creators of calm
title: This really changed my life,

review:
Falling asleep is the hardest part for me, much of the day is going through my mind.  When I listen to a sleep story, I don‚Äôt think of anything else. I always fall asleep without reaching the end, but that‚Äôs a good thing. I am biased though, my personal choice are the stories told by men but there are many narrators to choose from, lady‚Äôs and men, and they are all excellent.  I got a life time membership, it‚Äôs a wonderful way to fall asleep.   

Maria
title: Sleeping Peacefully

review:
I genuinely love this app. I got it to listen to Harry‚Äôs sleep story and just stuck with it and it has genuinely helped me with my anxiety and depression, as well as my gratitude and general attitude. 

The only thing I‚Äôd suggest is making it so that we can queue sounds after another. Like if I play a sleep story, it would be cool to be able to queue up a soundscape for afterwards so I don‚Äôt have to sleep in silence. 

Love this app, thank you for your great work!
title: Loveeeee this app

review:
First off: I Love this app, at first I really did think it was all hype and nonsense. I signed up to satisfy my skepticism and was so surprised with the sounds and the stories Calm played, I now use this app daily to help boost stillness and peace whether at work or at home, one of my favorite sounds are the peaceful guitar. When dealing with whatever challenges day-to-day activities may bring, I know I can count on Calm app to bring solace üíñ

I truly recommend this app!!!
title: REALLY GREAT APP!!!!üòÉ

review: I have had severe insomnia since I was a teen.  I came across this app as a suggestion from my counselor to help me meditate during the day and to fall asleep at night.  I am sleeping so much better now. I use a sleep story to fall asleep to and then a sound to help me ignore sounds around my house. The only negative thing is that I have no idea how the sleep stories end, as I am always asleep before they end.  (JK). That is actually a good thing.
title: Defeats Insomnia

review:
I have had the best sleep of my life over the last 35 days. Yes, the membership is expensive but there is so much you can do on this app.

I use the Harry Styles one every single night and let me tell you... I fall asleep in 5-10 minutes. It used to take me 1-2 hours. It feels like it had been longer than it has. This app is so helpful. I really recommend that you try it. At least try the trail. 

I really recommend!!!!
title: AMAZING

review: Had the app for just 3 days and I am loving it! The daily calm is simply brilliant! Would love it if there was an Apple CarPlay option. Would love to be able to listen to this on my ride to class in the morning or on long car rides. Also, for some reason, the app will just randomly start playing the daily calm either on my watch or on my phone and just wondering if this can be fixed. Other than that, thanks for being awesome!
title: Awesome, one issue, one request

review: These are just some of the emotions I‚Äôve experienced since downloading this app. Every day at the same time I receive a reminder to check in with myself and acknowledge what emotion I‚Äôm feeling. The instant I open the app and hear the rain falling my body instantly relaxes and I‚Äôm at peace. I love the ‚Äúchecking in‚Äù feature because it reminds me to check on me and allow some self care into my life.
title: Happy, Content, Calm, Relaxed, Excited, etc.

review: Read this before purchasing! I don‚Äôt mind ads or suggestions for other games to purchase in a game, but spending real money for a song that I personally don‚Äôt find calming, is ridiculous! Downloading this game I knew that there must be some spendings for high calming songs, but there is literally one story you can actually listen to without paying money! Come on! That is why I think there should be more options for non-payers like myself. Its a complete rip-off if you ask me. But don't take my word for it, download it yourself, then you can agree with me.
title: 60 dollars a year?! That‚Äôs outrageous!

review: I love the sleep stories. My problem is staying asleep. The stories work great for getting back to sleep but when they end, there is silence. Could the silence be replaced with either another story or some calming rain sounds? I can manually make that switch but have to wake up again to do so.  I guess I need a constant distraction from my busy mind all night!  Thank you!
title: Sleep stories are so helpful but..

review: Love the app as part of my daily routine and mental health. Because of that, I find that it justifies the annual subscription fee. But the latest update has a bug where it app randomly opens and plays my selected background music. It‚Äôs quite annoying as it happens whenever I‚Äôm in the middle of something (like work) and I have to close the app. That method doesn‚Äôt work most times, so I‚Äôve resorted to start a random session and pausing it.
title: Love the app, but please fix latest bug

review: Amazing App.  Something for everyone and something for every situation.  It took me a year to buy it.  A year we will never get back.  The mindfulness sessions are amazing.  The background music, stunning.  My wife and I race each other to sleep now!  The stories, inspiring.  If you are wondering if the cost is worth it, wonder no more.  You won‚Äôt be sorry!  There is too much content here to regret this purchase.
title: Worth every cent (sense) in peace

review:
Must try...this app is saving my life, and my marriage...helping my father in law cope with his own death, and bringing peaceful sustainability to nearly all life‚Äôs challenges...a tall order from the simple practice of mindfulness, in a well executed and regularly updated platform like ‚Äúcalm.‚Äù 7 day trail led to lifetime membership after just a few days. 
Thank you Calm team. Please keep this going! It‚Äôs vitally important. My 5 little girls are adopting this as well.
title: Changing my life

review:
What happened to the list of narrators? I have favorites, which are now hard to find. Many of the women are high-pitched and annoying. Probably better for children. 
Also, the app has been kicking off for a few days, when I close the cover of my mini iPad. 
My first complaint in two years of Premium subscription. Until you removed the list of narrators, I‚Äôd give you a 5.
title: Narrators

review:
Calm‚Äôs wonderful Sleep Stories have been my savior during the past several anxiety-inducing months of COVID-19 crisis. 

I am always okay if I can just get a good night‚Äôs sleep, but when I am stressed, I often wake up at 3:00 AM & cannot fall back to sleep. But just playing a Calm Sleep Story at low volume & really listening to it vs. the voices in my head works every time!! 

How do I know? I never hear the end of a story!!
title: Way Better Than Ambien!!!

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm since June 2016 (something I often brag aboutü§∑üèø‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è) I‚Äôve recommended this app to many of my friends, and they all love it. It‚Äôs been truly beautiful to see how much this app has grown over the years... More importantly the what positive impact it has had on my life and the life of others I know who also use this app. I highly highly recommend this app. It has something for everyone.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve tried Headspace so many times and had never lasted more than 3 or 4 days because the content would inevitably get so repetitive - not Calm. It‚Äôs familiar enough to allow you to feel a sense of progression yet fresh enough to keep you engaged, I‚Äôm a huge fan. I started the 30 day ‚ÄúLearn to Meditate‚Äù on a free trial and decided to get the full year subscription only a few days in. Big fan!
title: So much better than Headspace

review:
I've started using Calm recently and one thing that has happened is that the app starts playing my previous track in the background on my phone, which is usually cricket noises for me.

The soundtrack isn't controllable from the lock screen and I have to open the app to pause the track. Not sure what's triggering it, but it's kind of disruptive to have crickets go off at 2am or in the middle of the day, and this happens at least once a day. For reference, I have both an iPhone and Apple Watch.
title: Plays a track randomly

review: Going into the app, it was beautifully set up and looked like it could really do a lot of good. The more I looked the more I realize that there were only really 3 things I could do: a breathing exercise, 1 or 2 things to listen to (these only allowed day 1 of 7), and an intro to calm body (which just tells what it is, not any actual content). If you want anything useful out of the app, you have to pay. Maybe one day I will to see if it actually works, but at this time I do not have the funds to waste on it and still far too much stress. Thanks anyway Calm.
title: Looks nice, but can‚Äôt use it

review: I use this app every single day and in many ways, it has saved my life. One day I woke up and had uncontrollable anxiety and I didn‚Äôt know where to turn. I stumbled on this when I was looking for how to manage my anxiety without being medicated and it has worked beautifully to keep my stress and anxiety down. I also love the daily calm and the little images I can save every time I listen to it.
title: This app saved me

review: I love this app; it really does help and work. However, when you‚Äôre not made of money and don‚Äôt have it to spend $70 a year, it‚Äôs really not helpful taking up memory and space on my phone. I had downloaded it a year ago, and enjoyed using the free music and meditation techniques to help my anxiety, but my phone became outdated. So I tried downloading it again and was highly upset that just about everything is on premium. No offense, but if this app is supposed to help those who need it to keep calm and help clear their minds, how are the people like me who can‚Äôt afford it going to do so?
title: Helpful But Not

review: Ok, this is a great app I just have one ‚òùüèª suggestion. Why is there barely any free stuff? I mean I fell like it‚Äôs pushing you to pay üí∞, and I don‚Äôt like that! Out of like 100 üíØ or so! anyway I really want more bedtime stories at least!
title: Ok let me get to it.

review: What I thought was a free trial ended up being a 75 dollar year subscription of money that I do not have ! I could not sleep one night so I wanted to try this app for some meditation .. review:
I was the last person to even think about meditation and here I am. This app help me to relax and fight my anxiety during this hard time. I felt anxious and my stress level was out of range and slowly with each meditation I found myself calmer. I still worry but I can manage my feeling. 
I even introduced Calm to my son who was overwhelmed with lockdown we are experiencing and it‚Äôs helping him as well.

review:
I get that people need to make money and not everything can be free. I looked on the internet to find out if there are any meditation apps that are completely free. Calm showed up and I decided to give it another try. 
I have used the calm app in the past (years ago) then deleted it because more and more stuff within the app became locked unless you bought the premium version. I downloaded it again to see if anything changed and literally almost everything is locked and requires you to pay. 
I get it but it‚Äôs annoying that this app is being advertised as ‚Äúfree‚Äù when it is completely the opposite.
title: Not a free app

review:
Most of the meditations on this app start off with the author reinforcing feelings stress, anxiety and worry in the beginning. The idea is to tell you what you‚Äôre going to get rid of, but unfortunately it only reinstates all the negative emotions before it finally starts to help you work through them. 

If they had a skip button it would make a huge difference but there is none, you simply have to be reminded of why you‚Äôre using the app before getting any help.

If you believe in the power of attraction and how words and thoughts have power over that please avoid this app until the authors fix it.
title: Reinforces Anxiety

review: This app made me sleep so fast the sleep story‚Äôs are wonderful but I need more story‚Äôs I only have Stephen fry and I‚Äôm wondering if you could make all of them available because I have trouble sleeping and love this app I only stay up to like 8:00 in the morning thats why i need a sleeping app but overall this is a perfect app thank you for making this wonderfully app so calming this is perfect now that I have online classesüôèüèª

title: I‚Äôm not a big fan sorry

Don‚Äôt even know where this person is or what is going on.

review: One of, if not THE best health apps I‚Äôve ever used. I have difficulty falling asleep, I have my whole life. But the sleep stories have me snoozing within 15-20 minutes. My favorite sleep stories are anything read by Anna Acton, Nightfall, and The Story of Ubuntu. Please get Lesley Anne Brandt and Eva Green to read more sleep stories! Their voices are perfect for it.
title: Amazing

Maybe this app would be better if it had a more user friendly interface.  It‚Äôs just terrible IMO. I purchased to help with sleep issues. defeating  the purpose of my purchase.
title: Interface

review:
I started Calm just over a year ago. When I started, my resting heart rate was 92, now it is 67. I am not as diligent as I‚Äôd like to be with it, but have learned, through practice, to give myself grace. Throughout this past extremely difficult year, I have grown in value, to myself & others, through learning & sharing. Having another tool in my toolbox, in which to appreciate life as the wonder it is.
Thank you
denise
title: Calm

review:
This app has very useful guided meditations and soundscapes for getting to sleep, getting *back* to sleep, naps, and just relaxing in general. I do recommend.

If you want to sample the full paid content in the app there *is* a way to get a 1-month subscription to try it out (rather than jumping into a 1-year subscription), although it‚Äôs not publicized. Search the internet for more info.
title: Quality content

review: they‚Äôve locked all most all of the features to encourage users to pay for yearly membership fees. I did try premium for one year as a gift from a friend. So my heart sank just a little when I found out that there fewer free options now then when I started using the app. If you can afford it, I certainly liked the premium experience while it lasted.

review: I really love the Calm app and use it daily for my morning meditation and listening to the sleep meditation to help me fall asleep. title: I love this app but..

title: Amazing

title: Most loved app

review: I have had the Calm app for a couple years now and I‚Äôm a little frustrated at the fact that things I used to listen to often are now locked and only available if you pay for a subscription. Almost everything is locked now and I feel like it‚Äôs no use having the app if I basically can‚Äôt use it. I can‚Äôt afford to pay for the subscription. title: Why is everything locked now

review: I‚Äôve found what I was looking for!  Something to encourage me to be fully present in the here and now!  I tell everyone about this app, as I wish I would have discovered it sooner. My 5 grandchildren use it every night for sleep stores, and while traveling with the kiddos on long trips, at nap time, we put on the children‚Äôs sleep music. It lulls them peacefully to keep.  This app has been life altering.

review: I found Calm 4 years ago and have been using it daily ever since. I have Anxiety Calm has become an invaluable tool. It helps me sleep, it helps me clear my mind, it‚Äôs teaching/helping learn how to mediate and about mindfulness, and has even helped me from having panic attacks, several times. It really has changed my life and my well-being. I would give it 10 stars if I could!
title: I recommend Calm to everyone!

review: I was a bit sceptical about the price but with the way I have been feeling recently I had to give it a shot. After one session of daily calm I, I felt so much more relaxed and less anxious then when I went it to it. This has already paid for itself just with one session. I‚Äôll look at this as not just an app but a personal therapist in my pocket. Thank you.
title: Paid for itself the first night

review: Now, I just downloaded and off the bat, I don‚Äôt have 70$ to pay even for a whole year, I‚Äôm a teenager and have trouble falling asleep and I genuinely want to sleep, but every thing I‚Äôve looked at to help you sleep is in premium, and I don‚Äôt want to do the 7 day free trial and like it a lot to find out I‚Äôll have to stop because I don‚Äôt have the money to continue, I do think this is over all a good app but for myself what I‚Äôm looking for I can‚Äôt find :((
title: I thought this would help

review: Hi! This app is alright. I enjoy listening to nice sounds of nature (specifically fire crackling and rain/thunder). I can‚Äôt listen to really anything I want or even need. I‚Äôm not going to pay so much for pretty much the entire app. I came here so that I can sleep better. I have mild sleep issues so I need nature sounds to help. I can‚Äôt have any of that without a subscription. I don‚Äôt despise the app, I just wish free users could have a wider variety of everything. Thank you for reading!
title: Not my favorite. Read if you‚Äôre thinking about downloading.

review:
While I don‚Äôt use the services often, this app notified me of my upcoming renewal and made it easy to cancel my premium membership. This is in contrast to many similar apps that make it all but impossible to cancel. The experience of a clean ‚Äòcancel‚Äô process makes me want to sign up again... I know that seems counterintuitive, but it does. 

Thanks for a great product and treating customers ethically!
title: Ethical company

review: I have had the calm app for a about 3 years and what I have realized is I got this. Living in a chaotic, fast, stressful, distracting world can squeeze out all I have leaving me empty. The Calm app has taught me how to stay full and not to judge and hold on to my emotions. I don‚Äôt have to be perfect and that there are ways to handle anxiety, fear, sleeplessness and my over eating in healthy ways. I got this and it‚Äôs up to me to use these tools to a healthier me.
title: I got this

review: I got the app calm because I need better sleep j avoided getting it for so long g because something in my head said your a kid you don‚Äôt need help with anxiety and insomnia but that‚Äôs where I was wrong I‚Äôm up all night doing homework and stressing assignments I thought calm would help me sleep but after downloading I realized all of the sleep stuff costs money as mentioned before I am a minor so was unable to buy this without either getting in trouble or taken to a doctor for sleep and anxiety meds I got this app at night and it made me even more stressed please let me know if you make the sleep stuff free and I‚Äôll try it again
title: I got it for sleep

review:
I have trouble sleeping and seen a ad on tv about this app so I downloaded it and opened the app. It looked fine for the beginning then it gave me a pop up to unlock calm, (I don‚Äôt spend any money on apps) so I just simply pressed the (x) button I was brought to the home menu screen and did not realize how much stuff was locked with the free version. Like everything was locked...
Overall good app but you should really make some more stuff free on the app it‚Äôll give people less things to stress outüòâ.
title: Make more stuff free

review: This app was really helpful with a lot of problems that I have, or rather had. This app helped with building stability with my life. With everything going on around us, we get stressed and worried, and this app helped lots. This app had almost everything I never knew I always needed. This app helped me start meditating(definitely recommend meditating), having healthy sleep schedule and more.
title: Thank you, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù

review: I really love this app I really do. But there‚Äôs a huge limit of what you can do. There is no free content for anything. You have to pay in order to get in. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt afford to pay for it. I have problems with my anger and my mental state and this helps me, but sadly it‚Äôs so limited that I can‚Äôt do anything with it. The only thing that you can do is to just listen to background music and that‚Äôs it. That‚Äôs literally it. I highly not recommend this app since it‚Äôs 90% paid to go into anything at all.
title: Limits

review:
I recently experienced my first anxiety attack 12 days ago. It was very scary and disorienting but this app does have some things that really helped my get in tune with my body.
They have Yoga clips that help you ease tension and they have breathing exercises which are great, and it has visual and audible queues to help to stay in sync.

My biggest complaint is that there are serious paywalls, meaning you can download it but unless you subscribe, it feels useless. BUT, I don‚Äôt regret subscribing at all.

Other than that, I wish there were actually more yoga videos that you could follow along with.

They only have like 5 yoga instructions, and only 2 are videos. I do hope to see more videos up, but either way, this app has become part of my daily routine. I am grateful.
title: Great for Anxiety and Sleep Trouble!

review:
I had a stroke a few months ago, and from that, I had problems with OCD on everything sensor overload and ultimately breaks downs emotionally I crowded place. Airport gates, stores anywhere with options galore and people. 

My wife purchased the app for me and it's helped me to be able to be calm and remain in some type of control.  I do get away from the crowds and use noise canceling headphones.

Thanks for such a great product
title: After Stroke

review: When I first tried this app I loved it. I fell asleep so quick and I felt calmer then ever! And when I‚Äôm not going to bed I still learn good ways to calm down. But the only thing I dislike about this game is I have to use actual money to purchase other stories, sounds, and sleeping tips. But other than that this app is really helpful for anxiety, stress, and sleeping issues. I recommend that people who have these problems should definitely download this app.
title: So calming!

review:
I‚Äôve been using the Calm app with a premium subscription for 4 months now. I really love all the different meditation offerings and customizations of background sounds. I am often able to fall asleep with the sleep meditations or a sleep story. 
One request I have is to allow meditations to be queued. This way, I could listen to an emotions meditation and then a sleep meditation when going to bed without having to open the app to select which one.
title: Great app + Request

review:
This app has an incredible range of guided meditations - the sleep meditations and soundscapes are also fantastic! I really appreciate the different categories and instructors. 

PLEASE please consider adding more options for the guide‚Äôs voice? We all respond differently to voices, tones, etc. Tamara has a nice style but sometimes it just might not be the most soothing or helpful voice. Giving more options for most of the meditations would make this app perfect!!
title: Amazing but one major request

review: I didn‚Äôt have anyone to talk to for a long time, no friends or family or anyone and I had to figure out a way to help myself to be able to manage what I was going through and to also heal myself and Calm helped. I am so happy I came across this app and so grateful for all the effort that went into making these programs to help people like me. Thank you
title: Calm helped me through some hard times

review: Crazy about this app has something that has helped me sleep!!! I use the Scenes and Sleep Stories for both napping and bedtime. It has made a big difference on helping me to reduce anxiety about getting enough sleep. I use it at home and when I travel and that helps me with regular sleep habits, which are important. One of the best investments I have made in myself in a long time.
title: This app has profoundly enhanced my sleep life.

review: I just completed my first year of Calm and it is bar none the best app to save yourself. From early morning to drifting off to sleep there is something that fits your day. I love the Daily Calm minutes, motivational sessions and the most lush Sleep Stories (adore the line ‚Äúwe hope you never hear the ending‚Äù and I haven‚Äôt yet)! Thank you so much for this app, it is truly brilliant ü§ô‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Best app for everyone, every mood and every event

review: Went through a mental health crisis that left me with crippling anxiety( panic attacks at the slightest provocation) and situational depression. I bought a weighted blanket and started the meditations, sleep stories, and sound scapes. It‚Äôs been amazing. I‚Äôm finally able to fall asleep. The guided meditations help me slow down and deal with the mental health issues. It is a great tool to heal, but it is also great for people who just want to relax.
title: The only way I can fall asleep.

review: I have been a premium member now for at least 6 years........ I use it daily. For multiple reasons.... to obviously meditate, but to also listen to the music while I work or when I was studying....use it when I need to get away from the kids and husband for sure. My best excuse ‚Äúmommy‚Äôs going to meditate.‚Äù  LOL. I love Calm and also try to get more and more people to use it......‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Love this app. Can‚Äôt live without it

review: An example: my app doesn‚Äôt automatically update. Instead it just stops working. So I go to App and update - bear in mind I‚Äôve paid $60 or so for this privilege just two months ago - and now rather than updating it just freezes. I close. I reopen. I reload. I try everything. title: Too many tech issues over the long haul

review: The opening admonition to ‚ÄòTake a deep breath‚Äô is almost comically on the nose because, while it‚Äôs true that the app has lots of lovely calming content (honest kudos for that), the performance of the app is so ridiculously poor that you have to literally take a deep breath in order to maintain patience while you wait for screens to switch and for the app to finish going where it wants to go, rather than where you want it to go. Content is great, bu the app functionality needs a ton of work.
title: You have to be patient, is all I can say

review: Yes, I am putting down my favorites on the list, however there are a couple of things I wish I could have. One is a timer on all the stories, I only see a timer on the sleep stories. The other is that on the sleep stories there are a lot of talk on it. For instance, on the Jazz one, I wish to hear the music and less talk. Some apps are enjoyable with their stories but sometimes you just want the music (with the timer on). I like my Abide app it always has a timer so when I sleep so does the app.
title: Donna‚Äôs Sleep

review: This app is supposed to calm you right? When I went into that app, I wanted to listen to a story to make myself fall asleep. But this STUPID app made me get a vip/subscription/premium thing so I can listen to the story. So I went to a different story and that was locked too. I did the vip/subscription/premium thing and it still didn‚Äôt work. I had it, so I could listen to a story, but it was still locked. The people who made this app are greedy for money and it‚Äôs full of glitches too. I gave it 2 stars because I‚Äôm sure that this app COULD be good if it wasn‚Äôt filled with glitches.
title: No.

review: I love CALM‚Äôs enchanting and mellow sleep stories that gently transport me to other places and times. If I am having trouble getting to sleep or wake up worrying about something (or even can‚Äôt get a song out of my head), I have my favorite stories and narrators who take me away. I am usually asleep by the end, or relaxed enough to drift off. Thank you for keeping travel (and good sleep) alive and well during Covid.
title: My Travel Buddy

review: I really enjoy the app. The meditations are great, and I really love the sleep stories, which is why I jumped from Headspace to Calm. However, most of the stories I listen to skip and then instead of relaxing, I‚Äôm distracted by the skip. There is one consistent exception: Erik Braa. None of his stories skip! But now I‚Äôve listened to his same stories over and over again. Otherwise great content.
title: Mostly great, but sleep stories skip

review: I know I haven‚Äôt even tapped into all of the resources available on this app but so far the sleep stories are heavenly. They have put my nine-year-old to sleep effortlessly and he comments that he sleeps better when he goes to sleep with the sleep stories. As an adult I find them very relaxing and comforting and I fell asleep much more easily and stay asleep longer. They are kind of a miracle.
title: No more tossing and turning

review:
This app has been a godsend for my life. 

I‚Äôve noticed subtle yet huge changes in positive ways that have begun to really be noticeable.  
And I have just started to use This tool to fully develop my meditation practice after having been fairly sporadic, 50% of the time only for the last two years.  

I would ask for one slightly huge but specific thing that I struggle with at times of somatic trouble; that the language and the words that you so wonderfully select and choose to use but that may be  pertinent to issues of childhood trauma be softened down a tad more. (My first thought was to add in a complex/ childhood-ptsd selection for those like me.)

Thanks for your being and for this app!
title: Calm is where I go to find myself at peace!

review: I got this after seeing ads very often thinking it would just be a nice app with soothing sounds and audio etc. to help you sleep, but it‚Äôs a complete scam for money, and totally wrong on the part of the developers for not letting people who want to sleep well have free help. You can only listen to two things without premium (which are useless anyways if you don‚Äôt want to meditate), and it‚Äôs $70 a year for the premium. Totally misleading in the description, they very carefully make it sound like premium is just for a couple of the best audios, but it‚Äôs for 95% of the app. Don‚Äôt bother downloading, I‚Äôd give zero stars if I could.
title: Total waste

review: I use this app every night for sleep stories. I have 2 requests/suggestions. Please add NEW stories every 3-6 months and as another reviewer said, please have more stories read by Matthew McConaughey! I couldn‚Äôt care less who he is, but his voice is so soothing and relaxing. He only has one story and I listen to it several times a week just for the voice. Thanks for a great meditation and sleep app!
title: More New Stories

review: I‚Äôve got multiple disabilities. One of my biggest problems is not being able to fall asleep and stay asleep.  Doctors have prescribed meds but I don‚Äôt want to become addicted. I don‚Äôt even care for taking the Melatonin, so one night I tried ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù. It took some time, and in the beginning, some Melatonin, but now, I stay plugged in all night and sleep like a baby.
title: Better than a sleep aid sometimes

review:
The only reason I gave this app three stars was because nearly everything on this app has to be payed for. Really, seventy dollars a year just for a sleeping and meditating app? The only reason that I got this app was because of my sleep problems, and I can only get three to four sleep stories without premium. You may as well make people pay for the app, not for the membership! 
   Can you please make some changes and unlock more sleep stories? That‚Äôs all I want.
title: My review

review: I just got the app and wow was I surprised. I‚Äôm 59 years old and have tried many different sleep or relaxation techniques but they have all failed to help. I just went through the first session and I fell amazingly rested and calm almost went to sleep if it weren‚Äôt for me fighting it. I will continue through the 7 days and if results are the same I‚Äôm in thank you for the relaxation time and meditation
title: Review

review: I get this app free through my health insurance, which is the only reason I have premium. I love the sleep stories, and really wish I could do the meditations, however I cannot handle Tamara Levin‚Äôs voice (vocal quality and intonation). I believe she is one of the founders or creators of Calm so I really admire her work, but in order to use the meditations effectively we need a soothing voice. Please please fix this issue. I‚Äôve seen multiple reviews saying the same thing.
title: Cringy Voice

review: This is a great app. The free version gives you enough to begin. Later on you may want the extra content but the free version is awesome on its own. Included with the free app is a 7 day training program to teach you the basics. I have the premium version. My only complaint is I wish they would add a playlist feature so I can make a custom group of sleep stories that add up to the amount of minutes I generally need to fall asleep.
title: Great meditation app

review: I have never left a review for anything in my life - but this app has been so life changing I had to share. These teachings and the Meditation has given me so much in such a challenging and stressful time. I find myself more grounded, a better listener, more present, and more able to handle my anxiety and stress. Thank you to all the staff and creators at calm. This app has truly been such a gift to me.
title: This app changed my life

review: This app is really helping and if I didn‚Äôt find it I may have still had a lot of anxiety and I really couldn‚Äôt fall asleep. My stomach was upset because I had anxiety and was worrying about stuff. Thank you for this app and I hope that any person out there will take a chance on this app. It has great graphics,music,meditation,stories,and much more. Please please please give it a try  üëçüèª
title: This is great

review:
Sleep Stories, breathing exercises, music and more! I love listening to music when I go to sleep and I absolutely love the ‚ÄúTop Hits‚Äù symphonic/calm mixes (Tracks from Diplo, Ellie Goulding, etc.) 

Don‚Äôt even get me started on the sleep stories...listening to Harry Styles...I could listen to that story over and over again LOL. 

I‚Äôve done a beginner meditation and it really helped me get into a relaxing mindset. I‚Äôm really trying to get into meditation and the Calm app makes it easy to get into it! 

I have to agree with some other reviews... I‚Äôm not a fan of Tamara‚Äôs voice and I personally don‚Äôt think her voice is relaxing at all! 

PS: Through AMEX, I got a free premium year. HOWEVER, I would 100% pay for the full year subscription out of my own pocket
title: The BEST Meditation App

review: I was not immediately impressed with Calm. I found that I had to figure out what specially helped me relax and meditate. I found that there were narrators whose voice and manner worked for me while others didn‚Äôt. The thing is, that until you figure out what works for you, you‚Äôre just flailing around, but once you find yourself it‚Äôs really a top notch experience.
title: It Takes Time

review: I got calm about a year ago and instantly i loved it.  then a few months i bought the membership and it was a lot better!  I use this app every night to fall asleep, i use it when i get anxious and can‚Äôt calm down, i use it when i just want to connect with myself.  It can help anyway. i recommend this 110% and the membership is totally worth the money!! ü•∞
title: the best app on my phone!! üî•

review: Like the title says, calm is awesome app, I use it a couple times a day, not just for meditation, but the body calm, and the sleep stories. I am only in my first week of it, and had used headspace previously. I am not sure if Calms programs build off each other like Headspace does. But I‚Äôd like to get to longer and longer meditations with less guidance after their ‚Äúhow to‚Äù course. We‚Äôll see. But I‚Äôm enjoying it so far.
title: Great app, love the variety and options available

review: I‚Äôm not a person who would just instinctively get an expensive meditation app, but my sister recommended it, so I gave it a try. It has helped me tremendously deal with the increasing anxiety I feel as news and world events have shattered my sense of normalcy and stability. An app isn‚Äôt going to protect you from the worlds tragedies but this one has helped me a bit and right now that means a lot.
title: Times like theses need some Calm

review:
I saw a friend post about Calm 2 years ago. 
Life has a way of pulling us away from what‚Äôs healthy and through the lessons on Daily Calm I‚Äôve learned to judge myself less for the time on and off mediation... It‚Äôs through these meditations that I find myself coming back to it. 
Tamara Levitt does a wonderful job guiding through breathing. This app brings me so much peace and I‚Äôve recommended it to many
title: Always coming back...

review: I have had Calm for over a year now and it is amazing. I have the free version and yes, there are very little sleep stories and meditations and no sounds, but they have a lot to offer like mood check ins, a gratitude journal with different prompts and reflection journal. This really is a good app. Definitely recommend. The sleep stories and breathing exercise very greatly help put my 13 year old mind with insomnia to rest.
title: Love this app!

review: I quit using calm because I found a number of other free meditation apps that I liked. Next thing I know I had a renewal charge on my credit card for Calm. My problem is not with the quality of the app. My problem is with the fact that they don‚Äôt email you in advance to remind you of an upcoming renewal. Most apps provide this courtesy. So now I‚Äôm stuck paying $70 for something I‚Äôm not using. I tried to email them but they did not reply.
title: Calm Doesn‚Äôt Notify You In Advance of Your Subscription Renewal

review: There is almost no free content. One of the most frustrating apps I‚Äôve ever downloaded because you literally can‚Äôt even try it out because everything is locked. Listen this app is not free. There is essentially nothing of any value that isn‚Äôt locked. There‚Äôs some stupid sleep series. You literally can‚Äôt find anything else that is not locked. This is not a freemium app this is a straight up pay app that should be charged for from the get go because there is nothing free here of any value. Anyone that says that simply not the case is simply wrong.
title: There is virtually no free content regardless of what anybody says

review: This is more of a suggestion but as a regular app user I have mainly been using it for the sleep stories because you can choose who is narrating. I find that the main voice-over artist, Tamara‚Äôs voice is beyond annoying. I hope that more of the guided meditations have new voices added so you can choose hers or someone else‚Äôs. Otherwise I love the app and I‚Äôll add more detail when I have a chance to do more than the sleep stories üòÇ
title: More to come

review: I was new to meditation when I found Calm and I absolutely love it. The music, the meditations, they are all perfect. I love their daily quotes and amazing nature scenes. I have been using Calm for 2.5 years and I feel so much better. When they offered the premium subscription on a discount, I jumped on it to ensure I‚Äôll have it for life, and it was the best decision and best money I could have ever spent on myself. I highly recommend Calm!
title: Calm is the Best

review: For the most part it‚Äôs a pretty good app and has helped as I‚Äôve traversed this crazy year we‚Äôre having but the daily check-ins are driving me nuts. To have to choose only one emotion during check-in is unrealistic. I‚Äôm a far more complex individual than what can be relegated to only one emotion and the emotions listed don‚Äôt cover all of what a person may be going through. I like the check-in as a means of reminding me to pause and think but the details of the interaction are seriously lacking.
title: Good and bad

review:
I never considered myself a meditation guy until I really needed to start collecting my thoughts and find better ways to cope with stress and anxiety. As an iOS developer myself, I have huge respect for the developers of this application and the effort it took to make something like this, it‚Äôs truly a great application and I deeply enjoy the half hour a day of relaxation it helps put my mind through. 

Thank you
title: Amazing App

review:
I really love this app. I‚Äôve been practicing mindfulness for years and this is an easy and great way to practice and to enjoy adult bedtime stories. 
My only gripe, and it‚Äôs a huge one, is the sleep meditations narrated by Tamara Levitt. There‚Äôs something so artificially California new age about her delivery and it irks me when I should be relaxing. My options are so limited because of this. Most of the story narrators and meditations voices are great, so I don‚Äôt know what happened here. Nails on a chalkboard.
title: Get rid of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs Narrations

review: Sometimes randomly my phone will be playing the sound of water background from the app, when days have gone by where I have not used the app at all.  I have force quit the app to only have it somehow pop back up later on.   It seems to like to default to my music playbar on the ios slide down menu.  Im on a iphone max s with the latest iOS.... not a big deal but dont want a drain on my battery either.
title: Love it but....

review: I have been using Calm almost daily for about six months. It has really been an amazing tool in my healing of PTSD, GAD, and panic disorder. I wish there were more anxiety specific meditations, but I like most of the meditations, and they are still beneficial. The sleep stories help me sleep through the night. The Master Classes are amazing. I highly recommend the app all the time. Some of the best money I spent last year.
title: Fantastic App

review: It‚Äôs awesome I love listening to sleep stories at night it really helps me calm down and get rid of bad dreams the only down part too it is that I can‚Äôt unlock the calm premium besides  that this app is amazing it has things to calm down anxiety you can do meditation and you can listen to relaxing music and it recommends things for you after you fill out your daily mood for I love it I‚Äôm obsessed.
title: Calm

review: Content is repetitive and narrators are limited if you don‚Äôt happen to like the few they mostly use. I tried to find something relaxing to listen to when going to sleep, but the whisperer stories sounded awful and after starting and stopping a few sleep time stories I figured listening to any of my favorite podcasts would do much better for me. This morning I wanted to check out the stretches, but there‚Äôs no video and you have to listen to the instructions... forget about that too. I got this with AMEX for free, but no way I would pay.
title: Meh

review:
Just imagination is everywhere in these 1000 or more or less sleep stories! The sounds are so creative too, it is just the hole thing of sounds are unexpected in a good way i.e. rain sounds are so much more like rain then you would think!
Whoever is reading this review needs to get calm! Less stress and more happiness is on the way as soon as you press the button ‚Äúinstall‚Äù!
title: Sleep stories are the best!!

review: Mindfulness rules!  We came high told everyone who needed to know and we took a Happy Ending!!!  Your sacrifices were not in vain, not only did we take a Happy Ending, but we took the best existence. You didn‚Äôt need to know, we end suffering for everyone. The biggest Enemy gets the biggest sacrifice. We‚Äôre going to come up off these huge enemies who need huge sacrifices.  Everyone gets the advantage!!!
title: We did it!

review: Calm is far and away, my daily go-to for meditation and has often single handedly gotten me through the stress of being a mom, wife, sister, daughter and friend during the pandemic. And it works like magic to help my two boys, ages 9 and 12, when they need to reset their anxiety level. The sleep stories for kids are one of the best kept secrets out there. Every aspect of Calm is top notch.
title: The Best Meditation App, Period

review: I downloaded the Calm app to get into a meditation routine and it worked. There are many good series that I would return to, but over time I had listened to most three or four times, and aside from single Daily meditations there was not a lot of new (meditation) content to consume. Having only one narrator/voice as your guide is also limiting when that voice is not one that sits well in your ears (personal preference, I know). Amazing app to get into a meditation habit but not enough to keep me subscribed.
title: Great at the start, but limiting

review: I know that‚Äôs a dramatic claim for someone who has only had the app for 4 days but truly - I‚Äôm starting not to dread going to bed anymore. review:
During a pandemic, arguably people need a dose of calm more than ever‚Äîand this app exploits that need by charging a premium amount for their content. Almost NOTHING in unlocked in the free account. Not a large amount to some, but a record number of people are without work right now, and $65 could literally mean the difference between eating for a week or not. title: Total fraudulent trial program: once you click yes they bill you for a year and you cannot get out!

title: Getting back to sleep

review:
I have been using this app for years!  It‚Äôs the most used app on my phone. Here are a list of ways I utilize the features:
1.  I play gentle music in my AirPods while reading to drown out distractions.
2.  Plug in AirPods again for a 26 minute nap some afternoons.
3. Decompress with a meditation every now and then if I feel like it. 
4.  Play a sleep story before bed when I am having trouble unwinding from a busy day.
5.  Turn on soundscapes or a Back To Sleep meditation when I wake up before I need to in the middle of the night. 
6.  Background music for my homeschooling classroom when we need to refocus and limit distractions. 

I love it!  It is so much a part of my life now!!

review:

Upload more FREE content.

title: Love it, just wish it was free

review:
What I love: I use this app almost every night for the sleep stories, which are excellent and highly effective. Thank you SO much for providing such high quality scripts and voice talent. I also appreciate the variety of topics - and diversity of voices.

My issue: Most of the stories are around 30 minutes, which is long enough to put me to sleep. But then I often awaken when they end and have to manually restart or start a different one, which means more interrupted sleep.

My request: Please please please add either a playlist option or continuous play feature and/or more anthologies. 

Thank you üôèüíó
title: Sleep stories - options for longer play please!

When I started out two months ago, I had a wild monkey mind. I still do on occasion and my practice isn‚Äôt always perfect. But with Calm‚Äôs guidance, I‚Äôm now sitting in 45-60 minute meditations with no problems.

I feel balanced, my extraneous thoughts are silenced, and I‚Äôm living a much more aware existence. I‚Äôm very grateful.

I enjoy the app overall. But why pay for a yearly subscription when most of the guided meditations are led by one race? People who meditate are diverse so the variety of guides should be as well.

According to an article in the times:

Some archaeologists date meditation back to as early as 5,000 BCE, according to Psychology Today, and the practice itself has religious ties in ancient Egypt and China, as well as Judaism, Hinduism, Jainism, Sikhism and, of course, Buddhism. Meditation‚Äôs global spread began along the Silk Road around about five or six centuries BCE, as the practice moved throughout Asia. 

Given that, couldn‚Äôt there be more People of Color leading the mediations? Or at the very least as others have mentioned, maybe have alternative voices for various topics and sessions?
