title: Offer a monthly subscription

review:
The first meditation I tried here mentioned Stephen Covey. If you don't know who that is this app could be right for you. 

But for those with with any experience in or knowledge of what was once called self-help or even had a rudimentary introduction to boilerplate corporate motivational materials hoisted onto employees in the eighties and nineties, you might be left wanting more. 

I was suspicious of the big name celeb guests, like Matthew McConaughey but decided to try it. 

We are all trying to figure out life and depending on where you are on that journey, this might be your ticket. I really mean that. But for me, I find the approach from an app like Headspace to be more straightforward and genuine. 

I wish you well.

The help told me to change an option that did not exist and trying to send a help email spun forever.

review:
I‚Äôve never written a single app review before but this one has helped me so much that I thought it only right to share my experience. About a year and a half ago I started going to a therapist for depression, anxiety, and general mental health issues. In that very first meeting with her she told me to take a proactive approach and a good way to do that is to try this app. She recommended buying the premium version and I did and honestly that was one of the best decisions I‚Äôve ever made regarding my mental health. Now, I‚Äôm not going to sit here and say that my mental health issues are gone or that this app was a miracle cure. In fact, that‚Äôs far from the truth but I will say I use this app every single day and they‚Äôre constantly updating the content on there so that there‚Äôs something for pretty much anyone. The user interface is incredibly easy to use and you can always find whatever you‚Äôre looking for and they have a ton of options so you can try whatever looks cool. Meditation doesn‚Äôt work for everyone and that‚Äôs important to keep in mind before investing. However, if you think this app will even help you a little bit and you have 10 minutes every day to spare then I promise you won‚Äôt regret it. 
If you‚Äôve gotten this far into the review and you‚Äôve liked what I‚Äôve had to say so far then I might as well share my routine. I try to do the ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù everyday which is always a 10 minute guided meditation and it‚Äôs different everyday. There are also so many short meditations to chose from and some of them can be for specific emotions or situations which can also be really helpful. Having an anxiety disorder (or really a disorder of any kind) makes it incredibly difficult to think in present time and focus on the present moment, but the meditations on here have made that less of an obstacle. The thing about meditation is that it grounds you while you‚Äôre doing it, but it also trains your brain to stay grounded in your daily life as well and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so often used to treat mental health issues and that‚Äôs why it works. 
I also use the app when I go to bed because they have sleep stories, meditations for bedtime, music, and white noise sounds that will play until you tell the app to stop. The section on sleep is probably my favorite part of the app because getting a healthy amount of sleep used to be a huge issue of mine and now my sleep schedule has gotten so much better. Honestly if all of the other meditations didn‚Äôt exist I probably still would‚Äôve bought the app solely because of how much it‚Äôs helped me sleep! That‚Äôs truly how awesome this section of the app is.
In conclusion, what are you waiting for? Get this app!
title: Life-changing

review: So I‚Äôve only just turned nine but I have trouble falling asleep at night. Not because I‚Äôm worried or anxious or anything but my mind races with thoughts. I like to read for a while at night because I heard it was relaxing but when I put it down to fall asleep but I can‚Äôt because I get caught up in the story. I‚Äôm not saying no one should read at night. I just have a lot of trouble falling asleep. My mom got this app. (I don‚Äôt really know why because I‚Äôm not a lot of trouble but on the other hand my brother really is.) And I kept seeing ads for it so when this pandemic started I just tried it. The pandemic really got me off schedule. When we were still in school waking up at 6:45 AM was easy cause I was able to fall asleep at 9:00 PM but now during the pandemic we were able to wake up at 9:00 AM and I wouldn‚Äôt fall asleep till really late. Anyway enough about me more about the app. Your probably thinking this review is trash but just wait I‚Äôm gonna talk about the app. So the app is amazing even without the premium subscription. I started a while ago so you can take my word for it. I loved this app the second I started it but day after day I used it and grew to love it so much. My very first one was taking breaths and focusing and your breathing and just your breathing. I was trying to fall asleep that night but couldn‚Äôt but after I did that right when my head hit the pillow I was asleep. This is the best calming meditation app you could own. Don‚Äôt delete it if you didn‚Äôt like your first one. Try another and another I know you will love it. Get this app. You will have no regrets.
title: So calming (I‚Äôm guessing that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs called calm)
